channel.id: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James Constantinou's manoeuvring skills are put to the test as he drives a client's 40ft motorhome, and the Prestige Pawnbrokers boss also jets off to Marbella, Spain, with gem expert Kristen to value some precious jewellery. A self-confessed shopaholic hopes to sell two modern art paintings to pursue a new career in photography, while a woman decides to get rid of some of her designer handbags to raise cash for her hair extensions business.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: More customers arrive at Prestige Pawnbrokers, including a woman and her son, who are hoping to secure a loan against a 71-carat tanzanite ring they bought from a home-shopping channel. Prestige boss James Constantinou takes a shine to a bespoke show motorbike, and must fight against his instinct to claim the vehicle for himself as he seeks a buyer. Plus, a collection of 500 handbags arrives for valuation.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer revisit camel-racing couple Joe and Rebecca Fossett, who had outgrown their Warwickshire home and were hoping to spend their £700,000 budget on a place near their existing house but with eight acres of land. The duo also check on the progress of Nick and Katrina who were searching for a property in Jersey, to find out whether they took a safe option or went for something out of the ordinary.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Andy Wiederhorn, CEO of Los Angeles-based fast food restaurant Fatburger, goes incognito among his employees in order to learn more about his business that has evolved from a late-night hangout for musicians in the 1950s to an international success story.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Steve Greenbaum goes undercover among the workforce of his company PostNet, which offers design, printing and shipping services to small businesses. Posing as a failed motorcycle shop owner, he tries to find out how his staff are responding to firms that have been hit by the global recession.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day in the competition sees Andrew and James Widdas from the Rose and Crown confront their critics about their polyester bedding. Nigel and Pok U from the Bingham Townhouse have some explaining to do when it comes to their breakfast service, while Kev and Tor from Float by Boat are left in tears by the payments they receive.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hotel duty manager Andrew Carruthers hosts the first dinner party from Cumbria, where he hopes to impress his fellow diners with his hotel-themed evening, complete with five-star quality food including `early reservation fishcakes' and a `do not disturb truffle' in an attempt to win the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fitness fanatic Jonny Thompson hosts the second night in Cumbria, where he hopes to wow his guests with a meaty menu - and they get to see a lot more of him than they had bargained for.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Eccentric sheepdog trainer Katy Cropper hosts the third dinner party in Cumbria, where she prepares `come a cropper' prawns al fresco, opens a bottle of Champagne with a Masai sword, and serves some potent home-made horseradish sauce. Aside from the food, a sheep-herding demonstration proves to be a hit with her guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Holly Venning hosts the fourth dinner party from Cumbria and the food marketing manager wants to show her love for her home county through her menu. She prepares Cumbrian scallops and chorizo, followed by a traditional Cumberland sausage - but her Penrith fudge pudding doesn't appeal to everybody.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Estate agent Wendy Tinnion helms the final event in Cumbria and decides to throw a Friday night disco for her fellow diners. However, her guests are in for a shock when they discover something unexpected about their host.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help prospective buyers in Kent search for their ideal homes. In Broadstairs, Caroline and Ian are hoping to find a house for their growing family, while twentysomethings Sophie and Niall are looking for their first property in Maidstone.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps Berkshire charity worker Lynda Feymor find a place in Portugal's Eastern Algarve, looking at five properties within her budget of £175,000.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer revisit camel-racing couple Joe and Rebecca Fossett, who had outgrown their Warwickshire home and were hoping to spend their £700,000 budget on a place near their existing house but with eight acres of land. The duo also check on the progress of Nick and Katrina who were searching for a property in Jersey, to find out whether they took a safe option or went for something out of the ordinary.(n)

programme.title: Craft It Yourself
programme.desc: The presenters seek to inject some craft love into an uninspired bedroom. Furniture maker Robin Johnson gets a sewing lesson from Clemency Green when they make a quilt. She also tackles the art of Sgraffitto, while car maker Ant Anstead gets gooey making geometric candles, and there are some top needlepoint and pottery tips.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: An 80-year-old patient is admitted suffering from pain in her chest, arm and jaw, and consultant Sarah is concerned that Joan's heart is struggling and requests an urgent blood test and heart. Meanwhile a 26-year-old woman who fell and hit her head during a hen party in Ibiza complains about headaches, dizziness and vomiting, with doctors fearing she may have caused serious damage.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of six potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 43-year-old Cathy from Hertfordshire who, with her biological clock ticking, is wanting to settle down and have children. The trouble is she's open to dating men from their 20s to their 60s and finds it hard to choose. Will she find it easier to pick the right partner when they're all naked? Then, 24-year-old Londoner Adam takes centre stage. He hates online dating and has decided to bare all in order to find the perfect match.(n)

programme.title: Bear About the House: Living with My Supersized Pet
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the relationship between people and their exotic and potentially dangerous pets, including a seven-foot Russian bear who regularly has meals with his owners. Minnesota couple Mike and Valerie keep a one-ton buffalo that has to be showered in a car wash and goes on nights out to the local bar.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: An opportunity to revisit some of the best and funniest moments from the show in which viewers deliver sharp, insightful, passionate and sometimes emotional critiques of what they are watching on their televisions - direct from the comfort of their armchairs. The programmes under consideration include Britain's Got Talent, Happy Valley, First Dates, Caravanner of the Year, Flowers and Dogs Might Fly.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: An 80-year-old patient is admitted suffering from pain in her chest, arm and jaw, and consultant Sarah is concerned that Joan's heart is struggling and requests an urgent blood test and heart. Meanwhile a 26-year-old woman who fell and hit her head during a hen party in Ibiza complains about headaches, dizziness and vomiting, with doctors fearing she may have caused serious damage.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick and the team deal with two emergency cases in this edition. Lara the cat went missing after jumping into a removal van, but escaped, only to be hit by a car and then attacked by a fox. One of its rear legs is shattered and the vet has to perform reconstructive surgery to rebuild it. Chief, an eight-year-old Northern Inuit, dislocated its hip while chasing a fox. Noel thinks it needs hip-replacement surgery, but owner Nigel can't afford to pay for the operation.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Two-year-old Labrador Ira is fitted with a bionic spine, while anxious owner Rob brings in eight-year-old French bulldog Tom with a long list of chronic ailments. Matt and Rebecca arrive at the clinic with their three-year-old cat Marley, who may need to have a leg amputated.(n)

programme.title: The Question Jury
programme.desc: Stacey is determined to bring the girls together. It's a plan that may see her end up as the final foreman - or she may just cause further arguments.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James Constantinou jets off to Palma to investigate a yacht thought to be worth £150,000, while Prestige Pawnbrokers' memorabilia expert Lawrence values a guitar signed by Oasis. An impressive diamond bracelet gives new branch manager Alicja a chance to secure an international client and a vivacious prospective customer hopes the proceeds from the sale of a set of designer handbags might help get a new business venture off the ground.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: A teenage girl passes through the doors of Prestige Pawnbrokers, seeking to sell her grandfather's designer watch in an effort to fund her fledgling jewellery business. History expert Lawrence is delighted when he is presented with an autographed 1960s racing programme, and an online customer is shocked by the valuation received by her collection of luxury items. Plus, boss James Constantinou ends up crashing a converted double-decker bus when he takes it for a test drive.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer search for a Cambridgeshire home for Mary and David, who recently became parents for the first time. However, they are also challenged to find a house for the baby's maternal grandparents Edna and George, who have moved to the area to be close to their extended family.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Steve Greenbaum goes undercover among the workforce of his company PostNet, which offers design, printing and shipping services to small businesses. Posing as a failed motorcycle shop owner, he tries to find out how his staff are responding to firms that have been hit by the global recession.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Jim Rogers, chairman and CEO of Kampgrounds of America, goes undercover within his own company to discover whether his employees share his boy-scout philosophy. However, Jim's wife Sandy fears his naturally outgoing and cheerful nature could undo his cover story as a recently unemployed reality show contestant.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At Float by Boat near Rugby, partners Kev Argent and Tor Johnson run mindfulness breaks from their narrowboat, but Alison and Lynda are not keen on the tiny shared bathroom.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sports fanatic James Cox hosts the first of the week's dinner parties in Northampton, and he is confident that his French-Italian menu will bag him the £1,000 prize. However, some of his guests - Barb Wiles, Donna Harris, Duncan Fielding and Caroline Nash - are left confused by his Vichyssoise soup starter, and the tiramisu causes one of them to choke.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mother-of-three Donna Harris hosts the second dinner party in Northampton, and hopes that three courses of pure comfort-food will be enough to secure the £1,000 prize. Donna spends almost as much time fixing her make-up as she does preparing the meal, and when guests Duncan Fielding and Caroline Nash discover a secret stash of football shirts, they realise there is more to their hostess than meets the eye.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Part-time actress Caroline Nash is the host on day three of the competition in Northampton, and she hopes that a menu based on her travels will dazzle her guests. However, the night gets off to a shaky start as Donna Harris finds a hair on the side of her goat's cheese salad, while businessman Duncan Fielding seems more interested in goats themselves than the food.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Party-loving Barb Wiles hosts the fourth dinner party in the Northampton area, and hopes her Australian-themed menu will wow her guests and win her the £1,000 prize. However, the competitors are unnerved by her interest in extraterrestrials while snooping around her bedroom, and things go from bad to worse when a seafood starter and undercooked chicken result in tears at the dinner table.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Attention-loving businessman and keen cricketer Duncan Fielding takes centre stage in hosting the final dinner party from Northampton. He creates a menu based on the story of his life - which is full of surprises and full of spice - but it proves a challenge for three of his guests, who like their food mild. His main feature is a chicken and reindeer curry, and the table is impressed to discover that he runs a community pub from the bottom of his garden.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help prospective buyers in Wiltshire to find properties that meet their demands. Vicky and Andy's vastly different ideas of what they are looking for means one of them will have to back down, while house-hunters Malcolm and Jenny have spent four months searching on the internet without finding anything they like. They have only one requirement - the place must `give them a hug'.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Ben Hillman shows Warwickshire couple Lorraine and Neville Bulsara five holiday homes in the Spanish region of La Marina Alta within their budget of £160,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps mother and daughter Rhona Brennan and Nina find the perfect family holiday home that could also work as a B&B in the French region of Limousin.(n)

programme.title: Tried and Tasted: The Ultimate Shopping List
programme.desc: Michel Roux Jr is joined by First Dates love ambassador Fred Sirieix, food critic Jay Rayner, deli owner Stacie Stewart and TV presenter Lucy Alexander to put fish pie, lager and smoked bacon to the test. Plus, the quick-fire public taste test this time is for garlic bread.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty takes to the skies above Israel as he joins the battle to protect the bell pepper crop from the Mediterranean fruit fly, while Kate Quilton investigates premium-priced manuka honey, which is marketed for its anti-bacterial properties. Matt Tebbutt visits the UK's largest leek producer, where he's shocked by how much of the vegetable goes to waste, but amazed by a mobile factory on wheels that can process 60,000 leeks a day.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Croydon mates Josh and Jack take part in a double date, but problems arise after they meet Morgan and Jasmine, and both fall for the same girl. Meanwhile, divorced mum-of-two Sandy hopes to find romance with an astrology expert Steve, though incompatible star signs may be a problem. And tomboy boat-builder Abbey returns to the restaurant, but will she find a soul mate in Eddie, an odd job man who's nervous around women?.(n)

programme.title: Bear About the House: Living with My Supersized Pet
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the relationship between people and their exotic and potentially dangerous pets, including a seven-foot Russian bear who regularly has meals with his owners. programme.title: Rude Tube
programme.desc: Alex Zane presents a Top 50 countdown of hilarious, jaw-dropping internet clips featuring the most super-powered online animal moments, from the bear burglar to a gangster crab and the scary truth about how raccoons are taking over the internet.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away

programme.desc: The naive survivors of an apparent ecological disaster work, rest and play inside their utopian sealed community in the year 2019, each hoping to win a ticket to an idyllic island in a regular lottery draw. Sci-fi thriller, starring Ewan McGregor, Scarlett Johansson, Sean Bean and Steve Buscemi.(n)

programme.title: Dragonfly
programme.desc: Joe Darrow works as a doctor in the emergency room of Chicago Memorial Hospital. His wife, Emily Darrow, was last seen in a rainstorm in Venezuela, where she was on a retreat with the Red Cross offering humanitarian aid. She vanished in a bus accident. There were no survivors and her body was never found. That rich, green, exotic land is left behind as Joe is challenged to persevere through sad, rainy days back home. Joe promised Emily that if anything ever happened to her, he would visit her patients in the oncology ward. Strangely, the children seem to know him, and they say they've seen Emily in their near-death experiences. Joe starts to believe that his wife is using the near-death experiences of her terminal patients to communicate with him, through images the children report seeing in their dreams, and symbols they are inexplicably compelled to draw. While the children see Joe as a kindred spirit, the hospital staff worries about how these interactions are agitating them. At home, Joe begins finding other ethereal evidence of his wife's attempt to contact him from beyond the grave, some of it featuring the image of a dragonfly, which was the shape of the birthmark on her shoulder. His friends and a caring neighbor (Kathy Bates) worry that Joe is losing his marbles, especially as his quest becomes more frantic, putting his job in jeopardy(n)

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: A Swedish man opts for a sex change and undergoes the world's first gender reassignment surgery, but his marriage suffers as his artist wife struggles with the transition(n)

programme.title: Suffragette
programme.desc: A working-class laundress in 19th-century London becomes radicalised when she meets a brave cadre of women who are fighting for the right to vote(n)

programme.title: Midnight Cowboy
programme.desc: A naive Texan aims to become a New York City gigolo, a forms a mutually-beneficial friendship with a hustler who takes him under his wing. When the hustler's health starts to fail, the Texan turns one final trick in a selfless bid to take his new friend to Miami(n)

programme.title: The Green Mile
programme.desc: The lives of guards on Death Row are affected by one of their charges: a black man accused of child murder and rape, yet who has a mysterious gift(n)

programme.title: From Hell
programme.desc: Inspector Frederick Abberline is brought in to investigate the grim deaths of prostitutes in the shadows of Victorian London. Crime/horror(n)

programme.title: Morgan

programme.title: The Omen
programme.desc: After his wife gives birth to a stillborn child, the American ambassador to Britain switches two kids in their hospital cribs. What he doesn't know is that little Damien is the Anti-Christ(n)

programme.title: Gran Torino
programme.desc: Disgruntled Korean War veteran Walt Kowalski sets out to reform his neighbour, a Hmong teenager who tried to steal Kowalski's prized possession - a 1972 Gran Torino(n)

programme.title: Cast Away
programme.desc: A plane crash leaves a compulsive workaholic stranded on a deserted island for more than four years, where he's forced to adjust to a new life of solitude(n)

programme.title: National Security
programme.desc: Martin Lawrence and Steve Zahn star in this action-packed comedy by director Dennis Dugan about a hapless ex-cop and an LAPD reject who have to work together as lowly security guards. The two uncover a sophisticated smuggling operation and soon find themselves up to their necks in trouble when they are on the run from the smugglers and the police. Also starring Eric Roberts(n)

programme.title: Mafia!
programme.desc: Young Vincenzo Cortino, son of a Sicilian postman, travels to America to later become the clumsy chief of organized crime with his sons -- short-fused Joey and educated Anthony. One day, Tony makes a mistake and has to leave town. But when assassins try to do away with his father, he sets out for revenge(n)

programme.title: Dirty Harry
programme.desc: Director: Don Siegel. When a mad man calling himself 'the Scorpio Killer' menaces the city, tough as nails San Francisco Police Inspector Harry Callahan is assigned to track down and ferret out the crazed psychopath(n)

programme.title: Rendition
programme.desc: An Egyptian-born doctor is arrested on on his way back to his US home after a terrorist attack. His American wife campaigns for information on his whereabouts(n)

programme.title: Black Mass
programme.desc: The true story of one of America's most violent and infamous gangsters, Whitey Bulger. Johnny Depp stars as Bulger, who was the brother of a state senator and was eventually convinced to wear a wire for the FBI to bring down the Italian mafia in Boston after they invaded his territory. Scott Cooper directs, with Mark Mallouk penning the screenplay based on Dick Lehr and Gerald O'Neill's 2001 best-seller Black Mass: The True Story of An Unholy Alliance Between The FBI and The Irish Mob(n)

programme.title: Bug
programme.desc: This horror from director William Friedkin stars Ashley Judd as Agnes, a waitress in a run-down bar who lives in a cheap motel. Into her life comes drifter Peter who, having served in the Gulf war, is obsessed with the idea that he is infected by bugs implanted by the government during medical treatment. She begins to share his paranoia and the pair spiral into a conspiracy theory, becoming violently delusional as they battle the bugs they believe are within them. Based on Tracy Letts' play from Chicago's Steppenwolf theatre, this is a visceral, frightening film, but one that maintains an empathy for its characters up to the apocalyptic finale(n)

programme.title: The Scorpion King
programme.desc: Inspired by the legendary Egyptian warrior, The Scorpion King is set 5000 years ago in the notorious city of Gomorrah, where an evil ruler is determined to lay waste to all the nomadic people of the desert. The few remaining tribes, never natural allies, have to unite or perish. Knowing their enemy relies on the visions of the sorcerer, they hire a skilled assassin, Mathayus (Dwayne Johnson), to eliminate the visionary(n)

programme.title: Reign Of Fire
programme.desc: Twelve-year-old Quinn Abercromby witnesses the awakening of a hibernating dragon from a centuries-long slumber. Twenty years later, the dragon's deadly offspring are wreaking havoc and Quinn is part of a desperate band of humans fighting for survival when help arrives in the form of legendary dragon slayer Denton Van Zan(n)

programme.desc: Keepers are taken by surprise with the unexpected birth of a sea lion pup, while one of the park's best known giraffes has become very sick, and vets cannot work out why.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore properties about to be auctioned - two bungalows in Devon, a terrace house in Stoke-on-Trent and a Glasgow flat - before speaking to the buyers about their plans, and later visiting to see how the new owners have fared.(n)

programme.desc: An ex-RAF hero who remarkably overcame disability to become an elite fighter jet pilot helps another disabled soldier who shares his passion of flying.(n)

programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Julia Somerville and Angela Rippon look at why bacon loses its weight during cooking, and why scampi is not the fish you might expect it to be.(n)

programme.desc: Paul Laidlaw presents from the Westpoint Arena in Exeter as experts Gary Pe and Charlie Ross help two teams to try make a profit at auction.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts the quiz in which contestants must answer questions to help crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money. The jackpot starts at £3,000 and each time contestants fail - and that could be after just one wrong answer - they have to leave immediately and another £500 is added to the prize. Matt is assisted by quiz expert Lesley-Anne Brewis.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson is property shopping in Cambridgeshire with a couple of young newlyweds with a budget of £800,000, who want to escape London in favour of the serenity of the country.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: This episode comes from Norwich Cathedral in Norfolk, where experts Thomas Plant and David Fletcher pick out a Masonic watch and a commemorative mug to take to auction.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Holding Back the Years
programme.desc: A compilation of celebrities over the age of 60 reflecting on their experiences of growing old, as they meet with remarkable members of the public and look back on archive footage.(n)

programme.title: Watchdog
programme.desc: In the final episode of the series, Matt Allwright, Steph McGovern and Nikki Fox investigate the claims of big name estate agents, and singer Ricky Wilson explores why ticketing websites provoke so many complaints. Plus, Rogue Traders exposes a business lying to customers in order to sell them parts they do not need. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Wigan.
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and his crack team of builders, plasterers and electricians come to the aid of Frank and Christine Burrows in Wigan, Greater Manchester. In 2012, the Burrows' 35-year-old son Mark retrained as a scaffolder to follow in his father's footsteps, but was paralysed as the result of an unprovoked attack that left him with severe brain damage. Mark now needs constant care, but the Burrows' family home is not yet fit for purpose, so Frank and Christine have been forced to take their son to a care home 15 miles away. With the help of flamboyant designer Laurence Llewelyn Bowen, Nick's experts set about constructing a self-contained apartment alongside the Burrows' two-bedroom bungalow, which will provide Mark with the space, independence and security he will need to return home for good after spending two years away.(n)

programme.title: Olly Alexander: Growing up Gay
programme.desc: The Years & Years lead singer explores why the gay community is more vulnerable to mental health issues, as he opens up about his own long-term battle with depression. Olly joins young people on their own personal journeys as they battle issues that parallel his own, from homophobic bullying to eating and anxiety disorders, and questions what can be done to address them.(n)

programme.title: I'm Coming Out
programme.desc: Young adults come out to their parents about their sexuality, revealing how hard it still is to be gay 50 years after the decriminalisation of homosexuality. In the first episode, cameras follow 18-year-old Ross, who grew up in an isolated Cumbrian town, as he films himself coming out to his parents after keeping his sexuality hidden from his family and his local community.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts follow the fortunes of development projects run by parents and their children, reviewing the progress of their auction buys.(n)

programme.title: Going Back, Giving Back
programme.desc: Aled Jones travels to Northern Ireland to meet a father and daughter who suffered loss in the 1998 Omagh bombing, and finds out how they can help a terror survivor.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Food
programme.desc: A woman who has switched from sugar to honey finds out whether it was such a good idea. Plus, how buttery does a product need to be to use the word `butter' in its name?.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Caroline Hawley and David Harper advise two teams competing at Newark Antiques and Collectors Fair, Nottinghamshire, while presenter Christina Trevanion visits Derby Silk Mill.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Brian waits to hear the outcome of his trial, while Conor tries to shake Rachel out from under the crooked cop's spell. Sharon must do battle once more.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Retired friends Terry and Andy from Somerset bid to crack the three-digit code that will open a safe full of money. Matt Allwright hosts, with help from Lesley-Anne Brewis.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A couple plan to spend £750,000 on a home in South Devon large enough to accommodate their library of more than 3,000 books, and Margherita Taylor visits Agatha Christie's home.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: A collection of some of the best, unseen finds from the series, visiting the Milestones Museum in Basingstoke Ragley Hall in Warwickshire, and the RAF museum in Hendon, London.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Thief Trackers
programme.desc: The team uses GPS to follow a criminal who steals a camera and passes it to an accomplice. Casualty actor Tom Chambers hopes tracking technology will help find his stolen motorbike, and in the Shropshire market town of Ludlow, a thief leaves a very distinctive footprint.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Whitney is overjoyed when Woody turns up, but still finds time for old friend Lauren, who confides in her about Steven. Ted makes plan for his wedding anniversary party at the Vic but is taken back by Fi's prices. The police go to arrest Karen for stealing Arthur's Bench. Will Keanu own up to it being him?.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: John Sweeney investigates what is going on at the top of the charity, following the chief executive's sudden resignation in June. John meets people who accuse the RSPCA of being heavy handed by prosecuting them and taking away their animals when help or advice would have been more appropriate, and meets former senior insiders, who have concerns about the charity's governing council.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Whitney and Woody celebrate their engagement with a party in the Vic - but how will Mick feel about having Woody back in the pub? Keanu discovers whether he will be getting a full-time job at the end of his apprenticeship.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Emma Willis is the latest to take part in the popular genealogy documentary, in which famous faces trace their family trees. The TV presenter, who considers herself a true Brummie, is keen to learn more about her family in Birmingham, tracing back to Victorian times and her hard-working ancestor James Gretton, a local merchant. The Big Brother host then learns that her father's grandmother was born in Ireland. Surprised to hear of this new line of ancestry, Emma heads across to Dublin to find out more - but she is disturbed by what she learns.(n)

programme.title: Kicked Out: From Care to Chaos
programme.desc: Film-maker Rebecca Southworth sets out to find out why so many children in care go on to lead troubled lives. It's a deeply personal subject for Rebecca, who was abused by her father as a child and taken into the care of social services. She may have bucked the trend thanks to a stable foster home, but here she aims to find out why so many others seem to end up leading such chaotic lives.(n)

programme.title: Queer Britain
programme.desc: New series. Journalist Riyadh Khalaf, who was raised as a Catholic with a Muslim father, focuses on religion in this series shining a light on gay culture.(n)

programme.title: Queer Britain
programme.sub-title: The Search for the Perfect Body.
programme.desc: Riyadh Khalaf looks at body image pressures in the gay community, examining body dysmorphic disorder and eating disorders. He also strips off himself for a naked photo shoot.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Brian Conley invites Myleene Klass to pick the TV shows that shaped her life, with her selection including Fraggle Rock, Neighbours and The Wonder Years.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: At Longleat Safari Park, Kate Humble and Ben Fogle discover how a reluctant rhino is encouraged to take a mud bath, and cameras follow the arrival of lethal tarantulas.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: A mother and son take on a mother and daughter at the Royal Highland Centre in Edinburgh. Paul Laidlaw and John Cameron help the teams while Anita Manning leads proceedings.(n)

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Clive Mason investigates whether the recent terror attacks in London and Manchester have created divisions amongst the deaf community.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The North East chefs go all out to impress with their main courses, as they compete for a chance to cook at the Taste of Summer banquet. Tommy Banks creates a dish inspired by Wimbledon's guard of honour, Danny Parker tries to recreate the flavours of an American barbecue, and Josh Overington presents a main course inspired by memories of his grandfather.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Great War
programme.desc: Jeremy Paxman continues his history of the First World War with a look at the crisis the country faced as it became clear Britain was unprepared to fight a modern industrial conflict. As a result, the entire adult population was enlisted to turn the country into a war machine - from the women who filled the factories to make bombs and bullets to the men sent to the frontline. Not everyone agreed with the war, but any conscientious objectors who refused to fight were threatened with the firing squad, while striking shipbuilders were sent to jail. And with resources in short supply, even the nation's beer was watered down on government orders.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: A Taste of Britain
programme.desc: Janet Street-Porter and Brian Turner head to the Thames to explore the area's history and culinary offerings. They hike along the river's path to find Two Hoots cheese-makers, a family run business famous for its goats cheese. Janet learns all about Henley and the story of its regatta before rounding up some hungry rowers for Brian to feed with roast Aylesbury duck, olives and turnips at the Leander Rowing Club.(n)

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces a selection of old-school recipes. They include Keith Floyd's Irish stew, the Hairy Bikers' meatloaf, James Martin's ultimate bacon butty, a treacle tart from Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood, and a chili con carne from Lorraine Pascale.(n)

programme.title: The Great Rift: Africa's Wild Heart
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the grasslands of east Africa, and a line of volcanos stretching from Ethiopia to Tanzania, whose peaks provide a refuge for many wildlife species - which use surprising strategies to survive in such a challenging environment. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: This Wild Life
programme.desc: The drought begins to make everyday life difficult for the people and animals in Kenya's Samburu National Park, and Saba's plan to track down elephants for her guests goes wrong. Frank is concerned about a herd of young orphaned elephants heading into danger with no leader to guide them to safety.(n)

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough uses advanced surveillance technology to observe the feeding habits of herbivores, including elephants forced to undertake epic migrations to ensure a steady diet of the plants they need to survive. He also considers the habits of the sloth, which takes a month to digest each meal, and reveals scientific research suggesting that grazing wildebeest do not follow the rains as originally thought, but detect trails of phosphorus in the grass.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team return to Tredegar House near Newport. Among the finds are a locket that was a gift from Queen Victoria, a device used for creating tattoos, a classic car, a cigar cutter commemorating the opening of the Newport transporter bridge, 19th-century advertisements for public executions, a versatile tiara and a miniature font with a sad history.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Letterbox
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Mel Giedroyc in which pairs of contestants go head-to-head to crack a series of passwords as they attempt to take home the £2,500 prize money.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Former Strictly Come Dancing partners Zoe Ball and Ian Waite join experts Margie Cooper and Paul Laidlaw on a quest to find items to sell at an auction in Hampshire. Their search takes them through the south-west of England, with Paul telling Zoe a secret about buying antique hair brushes, while Ian offers dancing lessons to dealers to secure a discount.(n)

programme.title: The Sweet Makers
programme.sub-title: The Sweet Makers: A Victorian Treat.
programme.desc: This time, confectioners Paul, Cynthia, Andy and Diana use original recipes to recreate a Victorian sweet shop, and discover how the quest to satisfy our national sweet tooth transformed Britain. Guided by food historian Dr Annie Gray and social historian Emma Dabiri, the sweet-makers head to Blists Hill, Shropshire, to experience first-hand the life of confectioners in late 19th and early 20th century England. The team recreate a range of Victorian treats to stock their sweet shop, from jars of boiled sweets to their own version of fruit pastilles, and an enormous Easter egg. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Man Up
programme.desc: Premiere. While traveling across London to attend a party to celebrate her parents' 10th wedding anniversary, a thirtysomething single woman is mistaken for a recently divorced stranger's blind date, so decides to spend a chaotic evening with him. However, she has to face the consequences when he realises she is not his intended blind date. Romantic comedy, starring Lake Bell and Simon Pegg.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Birds of Paradise: The Ultimate Quest
programme.desc: Part one of two. Thirty years ago explorer Benedict Allen lived in Papua New Guinea with the Niowra, a remote people. Broadcast journalist Frank Gardner has always wished to see wild birds of paradise, so Benedict resolves to take him along. The duo set out through some of the most inhospitable terrain on the planet, negotiating swamps, mountains and crocodile-infested waters, heading into the cloud forest. Despite Frank requiring the use of a wheelchair following a shooting incident in 2004, Benedict determines to get him to their destination.(n)

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Clive Mason investigates whether the recent terror attacks in London and Manchester have created divisions amongst the deaf community.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Clare Balding is the latest celebrity to go in search of her roots, and she is particularly interested in her maternal great-grandfather. Clare believes he could have been gay, but getting to the truth of the matter proves a challenge when all the evidence comes from a time when homosexuality was illegal. Digging into her father's side of the family takes the sports presenter to New Jersey and New York where she uncovers an extraordinary dynasty and American roots stretching back generations.(n)

programme.title: Incredible Medicine: Dr Weston's Casebook
programme.desc: Gabriel Weston continues to unlock the secrets of the human body, with cases including a girl with two hearts, a man who can sing two notes at once, a woman who can bend in amazing ways and a man who can run 350 miles without stopping.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Brian Conley invites Richard Ridings to pick the TV shows that shaped his life, including the physical comedy of Harry Worth and the inspiration he gained from watching Oliver Reed.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: Keepers are taken by surprise with the unexpected birth of a sea lion pup, while one of the park's best known giraffes has become very sick, and vets cannot work out why.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Paul Laidlaw presents from the Westpoint Arena in Exeter as experts Gary Pe and Charlie Ross help two teams to try make a profit at auction.(n)

programme.title: Museum of the Year
programme.desc: Tristram Hunt, the newly appointed director of the Victoria and Albert Museum in London, presents coverage of Art Fund's 2017 Museum of the Year ceremony. This year, the finalists are London's Tate Modern and John Soane Museum, the Newmarket Heritage Centre for Horseracing and Sporting Art, Birmingham's Lapworth Museum of Geology, and the Hepworth art gallery in Wakefield. In 2016, the V&A claimed the coveted award, and here, Tristram seeks tips and advice on maintaining its lofty reputation from those responsible for running the museums up for recognition this year.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs Tommy Banks, Josh Overington and Danny Parker continue the battle to cook at a Taste of Summer banquet celebrating 140 years of the Wimbledon Championships. As each of them prepare their desserts, they will all be out to impress as only two can make it through to tomorrow's North East final.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Great War
programme.desc: Jeremy Paxman continues his history of the First World War. He looks at how Britain edged closer to defeat in the worst conflict it had ever known and Germany's attempt to starve the country into submission, which led to rationing, prompting the publication of the Win-the-War Cookery Book. Anyone found hoarding food was put on trial as newspapers exposed how the rich dined out on lobsters in London's Mayfair. Meanwhile, a film of fighting in the trenches broke box-office records - but what effect did it have on the British public's desire for peace?.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: A Taste of Britain
programme.desc: Janet Street-Porter and Brian Turner explore the cuisine and culture of Devon, beginning in Dartmouth, where a third-generation fisherman talks about the history of crab cocktails. Brian also visits Riverford Organics where he creates a beetroot and pepper tart Tatin.(n)

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces BBC archive recipes featuring unusual combinations, including Nigel Slater's cheesy apple pie, and Rachel Khoo's figs and chicken livers.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the lives of leopards and their cubs in East Africa. While other big cats such as tigers, cheetahs and lions struggle to survive, leopards thrive across half the world and even manage to live undercover in farms and cities in Africa and Asia. Jonathan Scott narrates.(n)

programme.title: This Wild Life
programme.desc: With the drought biting hard, food is in short supply and intrepid monkeys invade the family's safari camp, while lack of water means Saba Douglas-Hamilton is struggling to give her guests the experience they expect. Frank and David set off on a dangerous mission to help the biggest bull elephant in northern Kenya.(n)

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the world of rodents, whose constantly growing incisor teeth are used to chisel through any obstacle and range from squirrels and the English harvest mouse to the large South American capybara. He looks at examples of their dental prowess, showing how agoutis in Panama break open rock-hard nutshells and the skills employed by beavers in Wyoming as they fell massive trees to build dams rivalling feats of human engineering.(n)

programme.title: Golf: Women's British Open
programme.sub-title: Golf: Women's British Open Highlights: 2017 Day One.
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents action from the opening day of the event, which this year is staged at Kingsbarns Golf Links in Fife. The course is hosting the prestigious tournament for the first time in its history, and is expected to include a stellar line-up of competitors among the field of 144 entrants.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Letterbox
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts the game show in which pairs of contestants go head to head attempting to crack a series of passwords, in a bid to win £2,500.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents a look ahead to the event, which takes place at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, and is due to commence tomorrow night. Usain Bolt and Mo Farah are both expected to appear at these championships for the final time in their respective careers, with Bolt due to retire later this year, and Farah intending to concentrate on running marathons after the Diamond League event in Birmingham.(n)

programme.title: 10 Puppies and Us
programme.desc: Documentary following young dogs and their new owners over the course of their all-important first six months together. Telephone psychic Delia is keen on the idea of a big-breed dog to join her in her London flat, so canine behaviourist Louise Glazebrook arranges for her to try before she buys. Cocker spaniel Poppy joins the Vaughan family in leafy Surrey, where she gets the undivided attention of the children. However, three-year-old Isadora is a little too eager to play, even when the pooch wants to rest, and when Poppy bites back, Louise arrives with some advice on puppies and young children.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Lake
programme.sub-title: Top of the Lake: China Girl: The Loved One.
programme.desc: As the investigation continues, the autopsy reveals more that expected about the victim known only as China Girl. Realising she was a sex worker, Robin and Miranda do the rounds of Sydney's brothels - only for a startling revelation to send the case in a new direction. Meanwhile, Robin contacts her daughter's adoptive parents Julia and Pyke, who agree to a meeting. But things do not go well when the detective clashes with Julia. Elizabeth Moss, Nicole Kidman and Gwendoline Christie star.(n)

programme.title: The Mash Report
programme.desc: Comedian Nish Kumar presents the satirical and surreal take on the week's news, with a team of correspondents keeping viewers up to date with everything that has happened - or not happened - this week.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Birds of Paradise: The Ultimate Quest
programme.desc: Part two of two. Explorer Benedict Allen is determined to get disabled journalist Frank Gardner into the wilds of Papua New Guinea, despite having to grapple with Frank's wheelchair. As the terrain gets even tougher to negotiate, the pair know they must make an epic journey into the highlands, crossing through two tribal territories to achieve their objective. However, as Frank gets close to realising his dream of seeing wild birds of paradise up-close, his old injuries return to haunt him and the expedition hangs on a knife edge.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: The Boats That Built Britain
programme.desc: Tom Cunliffe discovers why the development of square riggers in the 19th century was one of the most beneficial advances in maritime history. He explores how these boats transported goods all over the world, and sets foot on a plank-perfect reproduction to reveal how the use of these vessels transformed Britain into one of the most powerful nations.(n)

programme.title: Inside Einstein's Mind: The Enigma of Space and Time
programme.desc: David Tennant narrates a docudrama exploring the story behind Albert Einstein's general theory of relativity, which turned science's understanding of gravity, space and time on its head when it was published in November 1915. The film takes viewers on a visual journey that begins in Einstein's young mind, follows the thought experiments that gave him stunning insights about the physical world and ultimately reaches the extremes of modern physics.(n)

programme.title: Hyper Evolution: Rise of the Robots
programme.desc: Dr Ben Garrod and Professor Danielle George explore the unsettling question of what it could mean for humanity if robotic machines were able to develop consciousness. The pair come face-to-face with a range of creations, including Kirobo, a machine designed to be a companion on the International Space station, and iCub, a robot that is forming his own unique understanding of the world around him.(n)

programme.title: Queers
programme.desc: As far as dapper gent Jackie is concerned, the 1967 Sexual Offences Act may not be as revolutionary as it appears. Monologue delivered by Ian Gelder. Written by Matthew Baldwin.(n)

programme.title: Queers
programme.desc: As the Blitz hits London, Fredrick is grateful he survived in a very unlikely place of refuge. Monologue delivered by Kadiff Kirwan. Written by Keith Jarrett.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: Is Your Brain Male or Female?.
programme.desc: Research suggests the connections in men's and women's brains follow different patterns, which might explain typical forms of gender-specific behaviour. Dr Michael Mosley and Professor Alice Roberts investigate whether these are innate or are shaped by the outside world, using a team of human guinea pigs and a troop of Barbary apes to test the science and challenge old stereotypes. They ask whether this new scientific research will benefit both sexes or drive them even further apart.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Logic
programme.desc: Computer scientist Dave Cliff provides a light-hearted look at the worlds of philosophy, mathematics, science and technology, all of which require a sound basis of logic. The professor creates the world's first child-run computer, and meets youngsters competing in the International Olympiad of Informatics in Brisbane, Australia, before assessing whether mankind can stay ahead in the field of logistics, or whether it is in danger of creating a machine smarter than the most logical human mind.(n)

programme.title: Voyages of Discovery
programme.desc: Paul Rose recounts the story of how American submarine USS Squalus became stranded in the Atlantic in 1939 after a fault caused a partial flooding of the vessel and the deaths of 26 men. The surviving 33 crew members were rescued by divers under the direction of inventor Charles Momsen, employing his pioneering underwater escape apparatus. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Inside Einstein's Mind: The Enigma of Space and Time
programme.desc: David Tennant narrates a docudrama exploring the story behind Albert Einstein's general theory of relativity, which turned science's understanding of gravity, space and time on its head when it was published in November 1915. The film takes viewers on a visual journey that begins in Einstein's young mind, follows the thought experiments that gave him stunning insights about the physical world and ultimately reaches the extremes of modern physics.(n)

The pair come face-to-face with a range of creations, including Kirobo, a machine designed to be a companion on the International Space station, and iCub, a robot that is forming his own unique understanding of the world around him.(n)

programme.desc: Peter Powell and Gary Davies present the April 4 show, featuring the Special AKA, Thomson Twins, Blancmange, Queen, Nik Kershaw, OMD and Kool and the Gang.(n)

programme.title: Shipwrecks: Britain's Sunken History
programme.desc: Maritime historian Dr Sam Willis travels to Africa to trace the origins and development of the `women and children first' protocol when abandoning ship - a code of conduct that came about in the Victorian era. He also reveals how the period oversaw trials of several other proposed solutions to high mortality rates at sea, such as life jackets, lifeboats, and rockets that could fire rescue lines on board stricken vessels. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Prejudice and Pride: The People's History of LGBTQ Britain
programme.desc: The second of two documentaries in which people share the items that have defined their lives in the 50 years since homosexuality was partially decriminalised in 1967. Focusing on the past 30 years, it features the nun-impersonating freedom-fighting Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence, the writer behind a famous lesbian kiss and a Muslim man who set up an LGBTQ support group for South East Asians. Presented by Susan Calman and Stephen K Amos.(n)

programme.title: Queers
programme.desc: Bobby is a swaggering man about town. But Bobby has a secret. Monologue, starring Gemma Whelan. Written by Jackie Whelan.(n)

programme.title: Queers
programme.desc: Steve, a groom-to-be, anxiously prepares his wedding speech. However, as the big day arrives, he has to consider what has been won and what has been lost. Monologue written by Gareth McLean and delivered by Alan Cumming. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: Timeshift: How to Be a Lady - An Elegant History.
programme.desc: Rachel Johnson embarks on a quest to find out how to be a lady. The writer and former editor of the Lady magazine explores the origins of the word `lady', from the time when it represented a specific code of behaviour, dress and speech, to the current day, asking why terms such as `ladylike' remain in use. As part of her mission, Rachel rides side-saddle, attends an etiquette school and visits her grandmother's own Ladies' College at Cheltenham.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Calvin Lee, an executive naval officer, appears to commit suicide by hanging himself from a public road bridge. When examining CCTV footage of the incident, Sam and Callen discover the dead man tossed away a small object before jumping to his death, and when they learn the late lieutenant commander had been working on a sensitive project involving new cloaking technology for submarines, they immediately take an interest in the item. The investigation draws the team into the furtive world of LA's Chinese community, where they discover Lee might have been harbouring some personal as well as professional secrets. Crime drama, starring Chris O'Donnell.(n)

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: Dr Sloan's insufferable sister discovers a dead estate estate agent in her new house - and the medical sleuth's investigation throws up no shortage of suspects. Dick Van Dyke stars.(n)

programme.desc: A father rejects his dying daughter and the son she had out of wedlock. Starring and directed by Michael Landon, with Lorne Greene.(n)

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: Hoss and Joe come to the rescue when Mexican farmers are forced off a greedy mine owner's land in the town of Prince River.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Abby becomes personally involved in the case of a murdered naval scientist who she regards as a kindred spirit. The team's initial inquiries turn up little concrete information about the victim's life, but the forensic specialist makes a breakthrough when she decodes some of the mysterious markings covering the body. Drama, starring Mark Harmon and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A lieutenant apparently commits suicide by jumping from an aircraft carrier and Ziva and McGee are dispatched to inform the widow - but arrive to find that she has been killed. Subsequent inquiries reveal that the injuries on her body were inflicted after death and the murder scene was carefully staged to mislead investigators. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Cote de Pablo.(n)

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: A young girl witnesses a violent crime committed by the Mob, putting her life in danger. The Rangers act as bodyguards as well as investigating the murder of a policeman.(n)

programme.title: JAG
programme.desc: Harm and Meg are called in to defend a US soldier jailed by Iraqi forces for crossing into enemy territory. David James Elliott stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A naval officer involved in an illegal underground street race is killed when his vehicle explodes. The team's investigations reveal he was carrying classified equipment in relation to his work on a new form of battery that the military had hoped to adopt, and that the explosion - captured on CCTV - is not in accordance with that expected of normal fuel. Meanwhile, Callen latest driving misdemeanour means he must attend traffic school. Chris O'Donnell stars.(n)

Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.desc: The team members are surprised when Gibbs asks DiNozzo's father to join them in their investigation of a murder committed at the US Naval Academy. programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs revisits his home town to investigate an assault that left one marine dead and another badly injured, and enlists the help of his estranged father to identify the assailant. Suspicion initially falls on a local man whose daughter was dating the survivor of the attack - but later inquiries uncover a tangled tale of uncertain paternity and forbidden love. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Ralph Waite.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. Ziva confronts her past when the team is ordered to protect her father, Mossad director Eli David, at a gathering of former heads of NCIS. The agents discover he is being targeted by terrorists who have hijacked a shipment of advanced weapons from the army. Drama, guest starring TJ Ramini and Michael Nouri, with Cote de Pablo and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: JAG
programme.desc: Harm looks into the case of a girl who has gone missing from a small Texas town where UFO sightings are an everyday occurrence and tales of alien abduction have entered local folklore. As his investigations proceed, he discovers she is far more likely to have been snatched by Colombian drug smugglers than little green men - but proving it turns out to be easier said than done. David James Elliott star.(n)

programme.desc: Sully, Kid Cole, Sister Ruth and Dr Mike are waylaid by stagecoach robbers while travelling from Denver to Colorado Springs - and the medic holds herself responsible for their predicament. Johnny Cash and his wife June Carter Cash guest star, with Jane Seymour and Joe Lando.(n)

programme.title: Touched by an Angel

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Karen decides to leave the interior design firm, and accepts an offer to become Jack's assistant at Out TV, while Will and Grace invite Vince and Nadine over to dinner. Guest starring Sex and the City star Kristin Davis.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Part one of two. Grace goes on an enjoyable date, but returns to find a message on the answering machine from Leo, so Will decides they should go on a road trip to take her mind off her cheating ex. Meanwhile, Jack and Karen try to arrange dates for each other. American sitcom, starring Debra Messing.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray goes on patrol with his policeman brother Robert and ends up foiling a robbery at a local restaurant by pelting the would-be thief with pizza. Comedy, starring Ray Romano.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray enlists his mother's help to reassure Ally, who is afraid to sleep in her own room because she is convinced it becomes the haunt of monsters once the lights go out. Ray Romano stars.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Martin tries to solve a murder case that has been preying on his mind for the past 20 years, but Frasier decides to step in with his own solution. Comedy, starring John Mahoney and Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: Fool Me Once, Shame on You, Fool Me Twice.
programme.desc: Frasier attempts to work his psychoanalysis on a self-confessed lazy criminal, who has stolen his briefcase and car and is masquerading as the `real' Frasier Crane. Comedy, guest starring Nathan Lane, with Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Attractive and popular psychologist Dr Honey Snow dates Frasier, who is so flattered that he agrees to write the introduction to her latest book - a decision that later causes him a king-size crisis of conscience. Guest starring Shannon Tweed.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Jim Rogers, chairman and CEO of Kampgrounds of America, goes undercover within his own company to discover whether his employees share his boy-scout philosophy. However, Jim's wife Sandy fears his naturally outgoing and cheerful nature could undo his cover story as a recently unemployed reality show contestant.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge suffers a nervous breakdown and has to be packed off for a well-earned rest, leaving Lisa and Bart with Patty and Selma, and Homer alone with Maggie.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Mrs Krabappel tires of her lonely life and searches for love in the personal ads, unaware that Bart knows of her plight and sees it as the perfect opportunity to make mischief. Meanwhile, Homer promises to stop swearing if Ned Flanders shaves off his moustache.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fifty-somethings Lesley and Roger, music teachers Emma and Chris, and teacher and ex-soldier Bonita and Tony take part in the culinary challenge in Leicester. Highlights include an international-themed evening inspired by the couple's love of luxury cruises and the youngest contestants desperate to prove they can serve up fine cuisine.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: A teenage girl passes through the doors of Prestige Pawnbrokers, seeking to sell her grandfather's designer watch in an effort to fund her fledgling jewellery business. History expert Lawrence is delighted when he is presented with an autographed 1960s racing programme, and an online customer is shocked by the valuation received by her collection of luxury items. Plus, boss James Constantinou ends up crashing a converted double-decker bus when he takes it for a test drive.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with Kate Humble joining Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: The Question Jury
programme.desc: Game show in which seven contestants must work together while locked in a jury room, as tensions continue to rise between Nick and Luke.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps mother and daughter Rhona Brennan and Nina find the perfect family holiday home that could also work as a B&B in the French region of Limousin.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Confident clothes shop owner Sacha, perfectionist Farazana, outspoken disability awareness officer Gary and cat-loving Kelly battle it out to host the best dinner party in Essex.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: A snowstorm leaves Bart, Lisa and their fellow students trapped inside Springfield Elementary and it is not long before the pupils are running amok. Homer and Ned Flanders are left to mount the rescue operation to save the kids - and Principal Skinner.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Ryan visits Ste in hospital after he's admitted with a chest infection, and Damon gets a date with Lisa, but it all goes wrong. Elsewhere, Simone insists that Leela and Zack spend the night at the Loveday's after finding out there are mice at the Lomax's.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Tried and Tasted: The Ultimate Shopping List
programme.desc: Michel Roux Jr is joined by First Dates love ambassador Fred Sirieix, food critic Jay Rayner, deli owner Stacie Stewart and TV presenter Lucy Alexander to put fish pie, lager and smoked bacon to the test. Plus, the quick-fire public taste test this time is for garlic bread.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: A compilation of some of the shows previous investigations. Kate heads to the Amazon rainforest to investigate rumours that the Brazil nuts on UK supermarket shelves are all radioactive. Meanwhile, Matt heads out on the streets to find out how the public feel about eating goat meat, and Jimmy takes to the skies above Israel to join the battle to protect the bell pepper crop from the Mediterranean fruit fly.(n)

programme.title: Old People's Home for 4 Year Olds
programme.desc: Ten four year olds are half way through an ambitious six-week experiment, as they share their classroom with 11 pensioners who all follow the same timetable in a nursery near Bristol. Has the energy and activities of the younger group had a measurable impact on the pensioners? Can this ambitious experiment transform the way Britain cares for its increasingly older population?.(n)

programme.title: The Windsors
programme.desc: The Royals have gathered at Balmoral, where Camilla is determined to exact revenge on Theresa May, who is in Scotland to stop Nicola Sturgeon destroying the union. Meanwhile, Charles is a hit with the Scots when it is revealed he has got no underwear on under his kilt, and Wills is shot by a wild Highland lassie, but who is the mysterious woman? Elsewhere, Meghan Markle is thrilled to get a part in Hollyoaks, but Pippa is determined to end Meghan and Harry's relationship. Starring Harry Enfield, Haydn Gwynne and Hugh Skinner.(n)

programme.title: Fargo
programme.desc: Gloria follows the money, Nikki plays a game, and Emmit learns a lesson about progress from Varga. Conclusion of the third instalment of the award-winning US drama starring Ewan McGregor, Carrie Coon, Mary Elizabeth Winstead and David Thewlis. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: Over the last decade, incidents of violence perpetrated by young men have risen by 22% and this edition examines the stories behind some of these calls and crimes. In Swindon, officers Emily Grigor and Simon Sanghera are called to arrest a man in his early twenties who has ripped off his top in a drunken rage before putting his fist through a wall and his foot through a window in a bar.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads for Boston to help change the fortunes of a failing Italian restaurant run by two brothers. The eatery's decline began when one of the pair started embezzling money to fund his prescription drug addiction, and things only got worse when the he was sentenced to four years in prison. With the time now served, he has returned, but must first regain his brother's trust before he can save their business.(n)

programme.title: Arbitrage
programme.desc: A businessman desperately tries to keep his past crimes a secret as he completes the sale of his company. However, a single mistake threatens to bring all the misdeeds to light, and as he struggles to keep his family from becoming involved, a police detective begins gathering evidence against him. Thriller, starring Richard Gere, Susan Sarandon and Tim Roth.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp revisits Aberdeenshire couple Karen and Russell, discovering they are not living in the property she found for them, but instead inhabiting a place they could never have imagined possible. In Buckinghamshire, Phil Spencer finds out how house-hunters Andrew and Emma, who had £625,000 to spend, are getting on in their new home.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: The host helps three homeowners struggling to sell their properties in Bromsgrove, Worcestershire, who are given £1,000 to make improvements before hoping to wow buyer Isabelle. Beautician Jo tones down the bold colours in her home, while Brian and Ann Marie take hold of their abandoned annex and garden, and Cheryl brightens up her bland decor.(n)

programme.title: Shipping Wars UK
programme.desc: Laurie boldly picks up a side load en route to the Chelsea Flower Show. It will boost her profit, but if anything goes wrong it could compromise her feedback.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie's Fill Your House for Free

Jamie Theakston presents.(n)
