Directed by Michael Thelin, Emelie made its world premiere at the 2015 Tribeca Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Resident Evil
programme.desc: Alice leads a team of commandos into the multi-national Umbrella Corporation's locked-down bunker, which is controlled by the main computer, The Red Queen. The unit is sealed because of a virus that gassed all the staff but, as Alice and her team discover, the virus has re-animated them. Now, as well as facing the computer's weaponry, they must tackle the living dead to prevent the virus escaping into the outside world. Paul W Anderson's horror thriller is based on the successful computer game(n)

programme.title: What Women Want
programme.desc: Nick Marshall, Playboy and hot shot in advertising, thinks he's God's gift to women. After an accident however, he discovers that he is suddenly able to her what women really think. Nick decides to sabotage his new boss by reading her thoughts and selling her ideas as his own, but unfortunately love gets in his way(n)

programme.title: Perkins' 14
programme.desc: Dark Ride director Craig Singer returns to the helm with this shocking horror film about a delusional psychopath who creates a unified team of 14 maniacal killers. Produced entirely over the Internet, where writers uploaded story details and actors submitted audition tapes, Perkins' 14 was released into theaters as part of the third After Dark Horror Fest. Ronald Perkins was just six years old when his parents were brutally slaughtered right before his eyes. Unable to overcome the incredible trauma of witnessing such a diabolical event, Perkins becomes convinced that the killers who murdered his parents will eventually return to finish the job they started years ago -- and he plans to be fully prepared to fight back when they do. Years later, when Perkins turns 34, he kidnaps 14 people from his hometown of Stone Cove and sets about reprogramming them to become relentless killing machines. Now, if the killers ever do return, they'll have to get through Perkins' 14 in order to reach their intended target. Trouble is, now that Perkins' 14 are ready for battle, they've become increasingly difficult to contain(n)

programme.title: Demolition
programme.desc: In this intriguing dramedy, an investment banker copes with his wife's sudden death by dismantling the machines surrounding him. Meanwhile, his complaints to a vending-machine company spark an unexpected relationship with a customer-service rep(n)

programme.title: Tour de Pharmacy
programme.desc: Sports-doping spoof focusing on a fictional, world-class cycling event in 1982 that was marred by one controversy after another, as recalled by five riders, commentators, celebrities and other assorted ne'er-do-wells(n)

programme.title: Her
programme.desc: Joaquin Phoenix stars in Spike Jonze's soulful sci-fi drama about a lonely writer who falls in love with his computer's highly advanced operating system. Theodore Twombly (Phoenix) has built his career on expressing the emotions that others cannot. His job is to pen heartfelt, deeply personal letters to complete strangers based on details provided by the clients of the company he works for, and he has a knack for finding just the right words for every occasion. Meanwhile, reluctant to sign the papers that will finalize his divorce to his childhood sweetheart, depressed Theodore has slowly withdrawn from his supportive social circle, which includes his longtime friend Amy (Amy Adams), herself floundering in a failed marriage. When Theodore purchases a new state-of-the-art computer operating system with the ability to learn and grow with the user, he sits down at his desk and prepares to get his life in order. Adopting the name Samantha (Scarlett Johansson), the perceptive software slowly begins to bring Theodore out of his shell by encouraging him to start dating again, and joining him everywhere he goes. Very quickly, their relationship turns intimate, with Theodore teaching Samantha what it means to feel human and Samantha giving him the strength to walk away from his failed marriage. Things soon get complicated, however, when Samantha's rapidly evolving knowledge base begins to alter the very core of their relationship(n)

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: A look at the dangerous world of camel racing; a report on the debate over Native American mascots; and a study of the injury rate among cheerleaders. Correspondents include Bernard Goldberg and Frank Deford(n)

programme.title: Jason Bourne
programme.desc: Jason Bourne emerges from seclusion to reenter the world of high-stakes espionage(n)

programme.title: Selena
programme.desc: Selena was a 23-year old Tejana singer on the verge of an international breakthrough when she was shot by the president of her own fan club. Her death spawned an outpouring of grief not seen since the death of Elvis Presley. This upbeat and tuneful biopic, executive produced by her father, Abraham Quintanilla (portrayed in the film by Edward James Olmos), is a celebration of his daughter's life, chronicling her rise to fame. The film opens with Selena (Jennifer Lopez) performing at the Houston Astrodome before a sold-out audience. The story moves backwards and begins not with Selena, but with Abraham who in the early '60s had an unsuccessful doo-wop group in Texas. As a child, Selena (Rebecca Lee Meza) showed an exceptional talent for singing. Abraham exploited that and the talents of his other two children to form a band. Much of the film focuses on the fact that Selena, though born in Texas in a Mexican-American community, had to learn Spanish as a second language. Her father insisted that she sing in the language, but it was not easy for her. To maintain the story's celebratory air, it only lightly touches on Selena's relationship with her killer -- the actual shooting occurs off-screen. The after-effects of Selena's death are also only briefly presented(n)

programme.title: Biker Boyz
programme.desc: Motorcycle enthusiasts should go hog-wild for this revved-up action flick. Laurence Fishburne is Smoke, president and ace rider of a biker club that engages in illegal street competitions. A young up-and-comer (Derek Luke) with a secret up his sleeve challenges Smoke to become king of the road and the race is on. Orlando Jones, Lisa Bonet, Vanessa Bell Calloway, Kid Rock(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Boss'
programme.desc: A look at "The Boss," a 2016 comedy about a successful businesswoman jailed for insider trading who seeks redemption upon her release. The film stars Melissa McCarthy, Kristen Bell and Peter Dinklage, and is directed by Ben Falcone(n)

programme.title: Leatherheads
programme.desc: In 1925, an enterprising pro football player convinces America's too-good-to-be-true college football hero to play for his team and keep the league from going under(n)

programme.title: Sully
programme.desc: Tom Hanks stars in this portrait of airline pilot Chesley "Sully" Sullenberger, which depicts his successful emergency landing of an Airbus A320 on the Hudson River in January 2009. In the aftermath of this unprecedented and heroic feat, the traumatized pilot must endure second-guessing by investigators, the weight of sudden fame, and his own doubts about his actions that fateful day. Anna Gunn, Laura Linney, and Aaron Eckhart co-star. Directed by Clint Eastwood(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible II
programme.desc: IMF agent Ethan Hunt has been sent on a mission to retrieve and destroy the supply of a genetically created disease called 'Chimera'. His mission is made impossible due to the fact that he is not the only person after samples of the disease. He must also contest with a gang of international terrorists headed by a turned bad former IMF agent who has already managed to steal the cure called 'Bellerophon' and now need 'Chimera' to complete their grand plan of infecting the whole world(n)

programme.title: The Last Witch Hunter
programme.desc: An immortal witch hunter joins forces with a witch to stop a plague that could decimate the population of New York City(n)

programme.title: Good Will Hunting
programme.desc: The plot revolves around Will Hunting, who is a janitor at M.I.T. and has a unique gift for mathematics. But irresponsibility and carefree attitude becomes a hindrance towards his progress for which he requires help from a psychologist to find direction in his life(n)

programme.title: Erin Brockovich
programme.desc: Fact-based tarring Julia Roberts and Albert Finney about an unsophisticated single mother who stumbles upon an environmental cover-up which eventually leads to a class action lawsuit. While working for a lawyer, she is puzzled by an old case and decides to do some research of her own. She discovers that a chemical company knowingly polluted the local area, and with the help of the lawyer launches a class action to sue the company for damages(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: Alex Jones. Alex Jones and InfoWars; Donald Trump's transgender military ban; Anthony Scaramucci; and the Senate's failure to pass the Health Care Freedom Act are discussed(n)

programme.title: Emelie
programme.desc: When their regular babysitter can't make it, two suburban parents hire her friend "Anna" (Sarah Bolger) to look after their three children while they enjoy a night out. But when Anna's behavior becomes increasingly unhinged, eldest sibling Jacob (Joshua Rush) grows suspicious and discovers that she's actually an imposter named Emelie who has sinister designs on the family's youngest child. Directed by Michael Thelin, Emelie made its world premiere at the 2015 Tribeca Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Resident Evil
programme.desc: Alice leads a team of commandos into the multi-national Umbrella Corporation's locked-down bunker, which is controlled by the main computer, The Red Queen. The unit is sealed because of a virus that gassed all the staff but, as Alice and her team discover, the virus has re-animated them. Now, as well as facing the computer's weaponry, they must tackle the living dead to prevent the virus escaping into the outside world. Paul W Anderson's horror thriller is based on the successful computer game(n)

programme.title: What Women Want
programme.desc: Nick Marshall, Playboy and hot shot in advertising, thinks he's God's gift to women. After an accident however, he discovers that he is suddenly able to her what women really think. Nick decides to sabotage his new boss by reading her thoughts and selling her ideas as his own, but unfortunately love gets in his way(n)

programme.title: Perkins' 14
programme.desc: Dark Ride director Craig Singer returns to the helm with this shocking horror film about a delusional psychopath who creates a unified team of 14 maniacal killers. Produced entirely over the Internet, where writers uploaded story details and actors submitted audition tapes, Perkins' 14 was released into theaters as part of the third After Dark Horror Fest. Ronald Perkins was just six years old when his parents were brutally slaughtered right before his eyes. Unable to overcome the incredible trauma of witnessing such a diabolical event, Perkins becomes convinced that the killers who murdered his parents will eventually return to finish the job they started years ago -- and he plans to be fully prepared to fight back when they do. Years later, when Perkins turns 34, he kidnaps 14 people from his hometown of Stone Cove and sets about reprogramming them to become relentless killing machines. Now, if the killers ever do return, they'll have to get through Perkins' 14 in order to reach their intended target. Trouble is, now that Perkins' 14 are ready for battle, they've become increasingly difficult to contain(n)

programme.desc: The story of the friendship that develops between a bright but awkward 12-year-old and a wayward man masquerading as a lone parent in a bid to seduce single mothers(n)

programme.title: Blues Brothers 2000
programme.desc: Dan Aykroyd returns as Elwood Blues in this long-awaited sequel to the 1980 comedy. After 18 years in prison and death of his brother Jake, Elwood is on a new "Mission from God"--- to reunite the old band and give a troubled orphan a new lease on life. Joe Morton, J. Evan Bonifant, Nia Peeples, Kathleen Freeman, Frank Oz, Steve Lawrence, Erykah Badu, Darrell Hammond. Directed by John Landis(n)

programme.title: Parenthood
programme.desc: Perceptive comedy drama following the ups and downs of parent-child relationships within a large family. An over-protective dad - determined to do a better job than his own distant father - anxiously dotes on his troubled eight-year-old son. His brother, meanwhile, strives to mould his toddler daughter into an academic high-flyer, and his sister struggles with two rebellious, angst-ridden teenagers(n)

programme.title: Continental Divide
programme.desc: When a newspaper columnist gets beaten up for his reporting on a crooked alderman, he's sent to interview a reclusive scientist studying birds in Colorado. The two initially clash, but romance soon develops before the reporter must return to Chicago(n)

programme.title: Down Periscope
programme.desc: Nautical comedy about an unconventional naval officer who is put in charge of an outdated submarine by a disgruntled admiral looking to get rid of him(n)

programme.title: Next Day Air
programme.desc: An overnight shipment of drugs winds up being sent to the wrong recipient, prompting a frantic race to recover the package before the contents are discovered in this fast-paced crime comedy starring Donald Faison, Mos Def, and Mike Epps. When Brody (Epps) and Guch (Wood Harris) received package containing 10 kilos of grade-A cocaine, they assumed their financial woes were a thing of the past. The package was intended for their Brody and Guch's next-door neighbors, but the whacked-out courier (Donald Faison) delivered it to the wrong address. Recognizing the possibility for profit, the scheming duo plans to sell the cocaine to Brody's drug-dealing cousin (Omari Hardwick). Meanwhile Jesus (Cisco Reyes) and his girlfriend Chita (Yasmin Deliz), the intended recipients of the cocaine, set out to procure the package before notorious drug lord Bodego Diablo (Emilio Rivera) realizes it's gone missing. But Bodega is no slouch; he already knows the shipment was botched, and he's determined to get his drugs back no matter what the cost. Later, as Brody and Guch prepare to seal the deal that will set them up for life, the guns are drawn and the chaos begins(n)

programme.title: The Big Lebowski
programme.desc: Classic cult comedy following the adventures of a Los Angeles hippie who, after being mistaken for a wealthy industrialist, becomes involved in an outlandish extortion scheme(n)

programme.title: The Nice Guys
programme.desc: A pair of detectives stumble upon a sprawling conspiracy while investigating the alleged suicide of a once-prominent female porn star(n)

programme.title: The Blues Brothers
programme.desc: Brothers try to raise money for a Chicago orphanage by getting their blues band back together(n)

programme.title: Martin Lawrence Live: Runteldat
programme.desc: Martin Lawrence is one of America's top black comedians, spoken of in the same breath as the late Richard Pryor and Eddie Murphy when they were at the height of their stand-up powers, and he's also appeared in films including Big Momma's House and Bad Boys. But he's also suffered setbacks in his personal life, from being arrested with a loaded gun at an airport to being accused by his co-star in the TV show Martin of sexual harassment. In this outstanding film of his stand-up routine, he confronts his demons and those who demonise him, as well as veering off to his favourite subject: women, and how hard they are to live with. And 'rundletat' is short for 'run and tell that'(n)

programme.title: George Lopez: Tall, Dark & Chicano
programme.desc: Comic George Lopez performs in San Antonio(n)

programme.title: George Lopez: It's Not Me, It's You
programme.desc: This live stand-up performance film by Hispanic-American comedian George Lopez originally aired as the comic's third HBO special, debuting July 14, 2012. Lopez takes the stage at LA's Nokia Theatre and riffs on such subjects as children, marriage, immigration,election activity and much more(n)

programme.title: The Nice Guys
programme.desc: A pair of detectives stumble upon a sprawling conspiracy while investigating the alleged suicide of a once-prominent female porn star(n)

programme.title: Rushmore
programme.desc: The critics were falling over themselves to praise this quirky drama that features a stunning performance from newcomer Jason Schwartzman as Max Fischer. Max is his school's brainiest kid by a long way, but he's also the most difficult - and when he falls for one of his teachers, it spells trouble. Bill Murray co-stars as a parent who provides initial solace and then competition for our lovelorn hero. Schwartzman is terrific, but it is Murray who walks off with the movie, along with a plate of carrots(n)

programme.title: Don't Tell Mom the Babysitter's Dead
programme.desc: When the mother of a sniveling group of surly kids goes on a much-deserved summer vacation, she leaves her kids under the charge of an elderly distaff granny. But then granny has a heart attack, so the kids load her dead body in a trunk and deposit the package on the steps of the local funeral home. The kids are ecstatic thinking that with the big wad of cash Mom has left, they can have a summer of consumer madness. But when they find out that the money has been buried with the baby-sitter, the kids have to fend for themselves to make ends meet. Teen dream Sue Ellen (Christina Applegate) tries working at a fast food restaurant but she can't stand the grease. So, she puts together a false resume and, posing as a twenty-eight-year old, she applies for a job as a receptionist at a garment manufacturing company. The company vice president, Rose is so impressed by her resume that she hires her on the spot as her executive assistant. Her deception looks to be working out great -- Sue Ellen manages to hold off the office lady killer, avoids exposure by the embittered receptionist, borrows money from the company's petty cash box for household incidentals, and continues her relationship with restaurant employee Bryan (Josh Charles). But suddenly, the clothing firm is set to go under, and Sue Ellen must use her teen fashion sense to save the company and her job . . . and she has to get the rest of the brood involved. Watch out for a young David Duchovny in a small role(n)

programme.title: Major Payne
programme.desc: Hawk-like Marine Corps officer Benson Payne (Damon Wayans) attempts to whip into shape the usual assortment of misfit JROTC kids in this minor remake of The Private War of Major Benson. Of course, both the major and his pint-sized recruits have something to teach one another. Payne teaches them the value of self-discipline and instills self-confidence in them, and the recruits teach him to stop and smell the roses (not to mention the fact that kids sometimes need coddling rather than screaming). And, of course, there is the annual JROTC statewide competition, which the kids are obligated to win before the movie can end. While there are some funny moments (the major's exhibition in full-dress whites at a school dance, for example), the script seems too color-by-numbers to be interesting to anyone other than undiscriminating younger viewers(n)

programme.title: Mr. Destiny
programme.desc: Drowning his sorrows after being fired, Larry finds a mysterious bartender who shows him the life he could have lived. Would he have been a different man if he'd hit that winning run as a kid?(n)

programme.title: Introducing the Dwights
programme.desc: 21-year-old Tim Dwight comes from a peculiar family; his mother, Jean, is a bawdy stage comic renowned for her scatological sense of humour and his father, John, is a faded country-music star who now works as a low-rent security guard. While dad is busy trying to revive his flat-lined career, mom spends most of her time doting on Tim and his developmentally disabled brother, Mark(n)

programme.title: Next Friday
programme.desc: In this sequel to Friday, Ice Cube returns as the streetwise LA dude who grassed up a local gangster. Who's now out and on his trail. This would be a good time to chill out in the suburbs with cousin Mike Epps and uncle Don 'Dc' Curry, who happens to have won the lottery but, as he finds out, money can't buy you love or security in Steve Carr's smart comedy(n)

Soon, all four of them are caught up in an international espionage imbroglio. Greg Mottola (Superbad, Adventureland) directed this action comedy(n)

programme.title: Bratz: The Movie
programme.desc: When best friends Yasmin, Jade, Sasha and Cloe arrive at high school, student President Meredith demands they follow her rules. Can the fashion-crazed friends defeat the evils of teenage conformity?(n)

programme.title: The Princess Diaries 2: Royal Engagement
programme.desc: Princess Mia settles in Genovia, but is required to be wed before she can assume the crown of her country. Her grandmother urges her to follow through on an arranged marriage(n)

programme.title: Garfield: The Movie
programme.desc: Jim Davis' comic strip comes to the big screen, as computer animation and live action meld in this charming tale about the orange fat-cat. Acerbic feline Garfield (voice of Bill Murray) finds his world unraveling when his owner adopts a cuddly dog. In kind, the territorial cat hatches a purrfect plot to remove the pooch from the picture(n)

programme.title: Fraggle Rock
programme.desc: Wembley's Wonderful Whoopie Water. Wembley's got a special talent; he can hear water in the rock walls. But when Gobo and Red don't believe him, he sets out to prove he's right. When water finally breaks out, the Fraggles discover that this type of water is special(n)

programme.title: Storybook Musicals
programme.desc: Lyle, Lyle Crocodile. Tony Randall narrates the music tale of "Lyle Lyle Crocodile," about a reptile who "The House on East 88th St." with a boy named Josh and his family. Based on a story by Bernard Waber(n)

programme.title: Casper
programme.desc: Based on the popular cartoon character, this family-oriented "ghost story" is about a not-so-scary spirit who bonds with a little girl (Christina Ricci). The eternally irritable Ms. Carrigan (Cathy Moriarty) discovers that the only thing she's been left in her recently departed father's will is a rickety old house in New England. Naturally, the woman is furious about this, until her "close personal friend" and assistant, Dibbs (Eric Idle of Monty Python fame), discovers a secret message that a treasure may be concealed somewhere in the house. The two take off for Maine, only to learn that the house is haunted by Casper "the friendly ghost" and his three ghostly uncles Stinky, Stretch, and Fatso. After futilely recruiting an exorcist (Don Novello, more or less reviving his Father Guido Sarducci character from Saturday Night Live) and a "professional ghost exterminator" (Dan Aykroyd), she brings in a "ghost psychiatrist" (Bill Pullman) and his daughter Kat (Ricci). Innocently attracted to the young girl, Casper befriends Kat as they try to save the ghosts' home from the evil Carrigan. Eye-popping special effects highlight this magical story that touches (albeit lightly) on the theme of what lies at the heart of human desires. Clint Eastwood, Rodney Dangerfield, Mel Gibson and The Crypt Keeper (of Tales from the Crypt) all make cameos as apparitions in the mirror Bill Pullman looks into in the house(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Sharkboy and Lavagirl
programme.desc: Writer and director Robert Rodriguez returns to the family-friendly adventure of his Spy Kids movies with this three-dimensional action opus. Max (Cayden Boyd) is a ten-year-old boy who doesn't get along with his peers and is constantly bullied at school. But Max has an active imagination, and he has a pair of very special imaginary playmates -- Shark Boy (Taylor Lautner), a human-shark half-breed cared for by a pack of great whites, and Lava Girl (Taylor Dooley), a girl with superpowers who can conjure heat and fire at will. Max may be a creative boy, but what he doesn't know is that Shark Boy and Lava Girl really do exist, and he is recruited to help them as they do battle against Mr. Electricity, a super-villain determined to deprive children of their sleep. Shot and originally released in the 3-D format, The Adventures of Shark Boy and Lava Girl also stars David Arquette and Kristin Davis as Max's parents, and George Lopez as a schoolteacher; writer and director Rodriguez wrote the film's story in collaboration with his then seven-year-old son, Racer Rodriguez(n)

programme.title: The Princess Diaries
programme.desc: Anne Hathaway and Julie Andrews star in Garry Marshall's family comedy about an ordinary girl who suddenly finds out that she is, in fact, a princess. She's not the most popular pupil at school, and is regularly picked on by the cheerleader clique. However, all that could be about to change: after her estranged father dies, it's discovered that she's directly in line to the throne of a tiny European country. But first she must show she has the bearing and beauty necessary for the role - and her grandmother Queen Clarisse Renaldi's first impressions are far from positive. Dane has the technology to do it too, as just before he was fired from his government job he managed to launch a special satellite that can set off any of the world's nuclear missiles at Dane's command. Unbeknownst to the villain, the CIA-agent Casey Ryback--who had boarded the train with his adolescent niece to take her back to her father's funeral--is a far more formidable foe than Dane ever could have imagined. programme.title: Thirteen
programme.desc: Evan Rachel Wood and Nikki Reed star in Catherine Hardwicke's searing portrayal of teens gone bad. Wood plays Tracy, an impressionable student who befriends Evie (Reed), the coolest---and most destructive---girl in school. Their lives begin to spiral out of control when they try shoplifting and experiment with drugs and sex. Holly Hunter received a Best Supporting Actress nomination as Tracy's mom. programme.title: Her
programme.desc: Joaquin Phoenix stars in Spike Jonze's soulful sci-fi drama about a lonely writer who falls in love with his computer's highly advanced operating system. Theodore Twombly (Phoenix) has built his career on expressing the emotions that others cannot. His job is to pen heartfelt, deeply personal letters to complete strangers based on details provided by the clients of the company he works for, and he has a knack for finding just the right words for every occasion. Meanwhile, reluctant to sign the papers that will finalize his divorce to his childhood sweetheart, depressed Theodore has slowly withdrawn from his supportive social circle, which includes his longtime friend Amy (Amy Adams), herself floundering in a failed marriage. When Theodore purchases a new state-of-the-art computer operating system with the ability to learn and grow with the user, he sits down at his desk and prepares to get his life in order. Adopting the name Samantha (Scarlett Johansson), the perceptive software slowly begins to bring Theodore out of his shell by encouraging him to start dating again, and joining him everywhere he goes. Very quickly, their relationship turns intimate, with Theodore teaching Samantha what it means to feel human and Samantha giving him the strength to walk away from his failed marriage. Things soon get complicated, however, when Samantha's rapidly evolving knowledge base begins to alter the very core of their relationship(n)

programme.title: Slumdog Millionaire
programme.desc: (2008) Danny Boyle's eight Oscar- and seven BAFTA-winning blockbuster opens as Jamal Malik (Dev Patel), a chaiwalah at a call centre, is on the verge of winning 20 million rupees on Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? . But the host of the show, Prem Kumar (Anil Kapoor) is convinced he's cheating and hands him over to the police to beat the truth out of him. Jamal reveals that the right answer to each question has come from a significant part of his life, from when he and his brother Salim were orphaned after their mother was killed in religious violence. As he continues his story, Jamal reveals how he knows each answer; how he fell in love with Latika, an orphaned girl from whom he was later separated; and how his brother Salim took the path of violence as a gangster's gunman. But as Jamal is returned to the studio for the last question, Salim finally repays his brother's trust. As well as the outstanding Patel, Jamal is played in different stages of his life by Tanay Hemant Gharu and Ayush Mahesh Khedekar; Salim is played by Madhur Mittal, Ashutosh Lobo Gajiwala and Azharuddin Mohammed Ismail; Latika is played by Frieda Pinto, Tanvi Ganesh Lonkar and Rubina Ali, all of whom turn in stunning performances. programme.title: Borat
programme.desc: Larry Charles' spoof documentary follows Borat Sagdiyev, Kazakhstan's leading journalist and TV presenter, as he travels through the heart of America in an attempt to understand the land of the free and the home of the brave. Along the way, he's able to congratulate a packed rodeo crowd for their country's "war of terror", enjoy a dinner with the cream of Southern society and engage in an unforgettable hotel-room wrestle that spills into a shocked conference hall. Sacha Baron Cohen stars as the eponymous Borat, scabrously exposing smalltown America's prejudices in the company of his producer Azamat Bagatov. Other highlights include the two men engaged in nude wrestling and, of course, Borat's kidnapping of Pamela Anderson(n)

programme.title: Peep World

programme.title: American Wedding
programme.desc: The third film of the successful American Pie series, which started to shake the box-offices in 1999. Jim (Jason Biggs) is about to marry Michelle, while his crazy friends, Finch, Stifler and Kevin, still have their hormones somewhat worked up. Apart from rushing to make all the arrangements for the wedding, Jim must strive to gain the approval of his parents-in-law, and, to make matters worse, he has to battle with the restrictions of his grandmother, who is against the wedding because Michelle is not Jewish. In addition, the arrival of Cadence, the bride's youngest sister, completely upsets the situation. Finch and Stifler fall in love with her and start a heated dispute, where one of them is the rebel, and the other, prince charming. Of course, a crazy stag party could not be left out. The director of this film, Jesse Dylan, is Bob Dylan's son(n)

programme.title: American Pie Presents: Beta House
programme.desc: It's pledge time, and as fraternity row becomes rife with eager young freshman looking to make an impression on campus, the stage is set for Greek rivalry so fierce it will resurrect a competition that was previously banned by the administration. Great Falls high school graduates Erik and Cooze are about to become college freshmen, and once they do, the campus of a modest Michigan college will never be the same. Immediately aligning themselves with the notorious Beta Delta Xi house, the boys dive headlong into the party scene while suddenly being swept up in an ongoing rivalry between their new brothers and a rival house with a power-hungry president. Now the only way for the Beta Delta Xi brothers to prove their true worth is to resurrect The Games - a long-banned competition that will discern the true kings of campus once and for all. Featuring Eugene Levy and Christopher McDonald(n)

programme.title: House on Haunted Hill
programme.desc: Classic horror film starring Vincent Price and Carol Ohmart. Guests are invited to a sinister house by a mysterious host. Each one is in jeopardy of being murdered by the end of the night(n)

programme.title: Red Dragon
programme.desc: Hannibal "The Cannibal" Lecter (Anthony Hopkins) helps an FBI agent track down a serial killer. Violent, mildly entertaining remake of "Manhunter." Edward Norton, Emily Watson. Adapted from Thomas Harris's first Lecter novel by screenwriter Ted Tally, who won an Oscar for "The Silence of the Lambs." Directed by Brett Ratner(n)

programme.title: RoboCop 2
programme.desc: Once again Detroit is ridden by a gang of drug dealers and Robocop is the only one who can do something about it. When Cain, the chief of the gang, is killed during his confrontation with Robocop, OCP (the company that runs the police) transforms him into Robocop 2, a new android much stronger than the first one. Now Murphy has to face him again, because Cain didn't forget who he was(n)

programme.title: RoboCop 3
programme.desc: The cyborg defends impoverished Detroit citizens whose homes are threatened by an evil corporation formed by his creators, who have gone corrupt(n)

programme.title: 28 Weeks Later
programme.desc: Six months have passed since the rage virus has annihilated the British Isles. The U.S. Army declares that the war against infection has been won, and that the reconstruction of the country can begin. As the first wave of refugees return, a family is reunited--but one of them unwittingly carries a terrible secret(n)

programme.title: Drive
programme.desc: A lone-wolf Hollywood stunt driver who moonlights as a getaway wheelman races to save his pretty neighbour and her young son after he incurs the wrath of LA's most-feared criminal kingpin during a botched heist(n)

programme.title: Unstoppable
programme.desc: Denzel Washington and Chris Pine star in this intense action thriller, the final work to be directed by the late Tony Scott. Veteran railroad employee Frank Barnes has his quarrels with the new guy on the job, Will Colson, largely because the younger man is about to replace him. But they must join forces and race against time when an enormous runaway train carrying toxic chemicals heads their way. If its terminal destination in a city wasn't bad enough, the lethal behemoth is also on the same line as another train carrying 150 children home from a school trip. When the railroad company's chairman refuses to take action for financial reasons, Frank takes it upon himself to save the day, despite the seemingly suicidal nature of the mission and the devastating consequences it's likely to have for his loved ones. Will opposes Frank's ridiculously dangerous idea, but joins him anyway. Can the two men patch up their differences and save the day? In addition to the nail-biting action, the score beautifully highlights the suspense, and earned the film a nomination for the Academy Award for Best Sound Editing. Also starring Ethan Suplee, TJ Miller and Kevin Chapman(n)

programme.title: RoboCop
programme.desc: Detroit...in the near future. A cop who dies in the line of duty is transformed into a chrome-plated, indestructible, crime-fighting cyborg by the corporation which now runs the police department. The only hitch: this perfect cop still seeks revenge on the sadistic creeps who mutilated him(n)

programme.title: Inside London Fire Brigade
programme.desc: One hundred firefighters are mobilised when a garden centre near Heathrow goes up in flames, and things take a dramatic turn after it is discovered there is a large quantity of gas canisters on site. Borough commander Steve is called to a road traffic accident in Shoreditch, where a woman with suspected spinal injuries needs to be cut free from her car. In Battersea, crew manager Edric is considering leaving his specialist rescue team to do more traditional firefighting - and his next call-out helps with his decision.(n)

programme.title: Schofield's South African Adventure
programme.desc: Diving with one of the world's most dangerous predators has long been a bucket list dream for This Morning host Phillip Schofield. Here he travels to Gansbaai in South Africa to wait underwater in a cage to catch a glimpse of a great white shark up close. But this is only part of his excursion, as together with his wife Steph, he starts his trip with a walk around Cape Town, marvelling at the stunning scenery, including Table Mountain - down which Phillip intends to abseil. They also join a group of drummers to see if they can pick up some of the rhythms of this remarkable country.(n)

programme.title: Lion Country: Night and Day
programme.desc: Cameras follow two prides of lions in their territory of Zambia's South Luangwa National Park over the course of six months. A cub's curiosity gets the better of him when it strays from the pride's territory, and becomes easy prey for leopards and hyenas. A lioness tries to rejoin a pride, but many of the males in the group are resistant to the idea. The camera crew gets closer to the big cats than they bargained for, and are forced to beat a hasty retreat.(n)

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: Feature-length finale of the African-set wildlife drama. It's New Year's Eve and Alice has returned to Leopard's Den, but the stress of combining work with caring for a baby is causing tension between her and Danny. They then receive devastating news - two cheetahs have been taken by poachers. With only days until the wedding of Rosie and Dylan - who isn't endearing himself to anybody - tempers are already running high when Du Plessis finds out his heart is weak. Realising he must use his remaining time to help the family, he persuades pilot Dylan to fly them all to Zimbabwe to rescue the stolen animals in the hope that the trip will convince Danny his future son-in-law is worthy. Stephen Tompkinson, Dawn Steele, Lucy-Jo Hudson and Hayley Mills star. Last in the series.(n)

programme.sub-title: Football: Audi Cup Live: Third-Place Play-Off.
programme.desc: The Third-Place play-off (Kick-off 4.45pm). Coverage of the match between yesterday's losing semi-finalists, which takes place at Allianz Arena in Munich. programme.title: Live Pre-Season Football
programme.desc: The final (Kick-off 7.30pm). Coverage of the match between yesterday's victorious semi-finalists, which takes place at Allianz Arena in Munich. While lifting this trophy is unlikely to herald in a new era of success for the winners, the team to emerge triumphant will receive a boost in morale for having a claimed a second high-profile scalp in as many days, especially with the new season drawing ever closer. programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps Christine Vaughan, who is looking for a holiday home in Barbados on a budget of £150,000 and also wants to generate income by renting out the property. However, the Caribbean island's sunny weather leaves Christine struggling to focus on business.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition gets underway at Springbank Guest House in Whaley Bridge, Derbyshire, where Susan Torkington offers her guests the chance to learn the art of cheerleading. However, the jovial atmosphere is ruined when three stray hairs leave her fuming by leaving time.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The Old Dairy in Bishops Barton, Somerset, run by former IT consultant Liz Cannon, is the venue for the second day of the competition. The guests encounter a digging session, a big argument and a close encounter with a hot teapot.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to the Toll House B&B in Saffron Walden, Essex, which is owned by Laurie and Carole Poole, featuring a competitive art session and a disturbed night's sleep for some of the guests. However, the plentiful breakfast proves to be a winner.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Maria Ettridge hosts the final visit at the Roebuck in Marchwood, Hampshire, where she hopes to entertain her guests with an afternoon lesson in woodland survival skills. However, things go downhill when they are unimpressed with their rooms and two of the contestants clash over dinner.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the final time to discover what their guests chose to pay. Tempers flare as the payments are revealed, and the contestants take the chance to settle some scores.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman embarks on a property search on the Caribbean island of St Vincent, and finds that a budget of £200,000 and house-hunters with uncompromising tastes force her to take drastic action to locate a suitable home.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton tries to find a property in Marbella, Costa del Sol, on behalf of golf enthusiast Terry Hannaford and his eldest daughter Sarah, who have a £200,000 budget. House prices are the lowest they have been for a decade, but the pair's high expectations make life difficult for the presenter.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson gets to choose a site for investigation and decides to take the team to Jersey, where a German anti-aircraft battery was built during the Second World War. As the experts explore the area, they realise it contained a large and complex settlement, and discover shocking facts about the islanders' suffering during the war.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team search for Roman artefacts beneath the graveyard of St Kyneburgha's Church in Castor, Cambridgeshire. With several reports of similar finds in and around the village, speculation mounts that they could uncover the remnants of a praetorium - a huge building that would have dominated the region's skyline during the period. However, as the experts start digging in other nearby locations, they discover that not all the evidence points to the same conclusion.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: A labradoodle is brought in to the surgery as it is constantly scratching his ears and Scott Harris discovers it has a grass seed lodged deep in its ear canal.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect meets Scottish farmers Julie and George Nicholson, who have taken an enormous financial risk by spending their entire £30,000 savings on a prototype modular holiday home. He also meets Bournemouth couple Andrew and Emma Collett, who instead of a honeymoon spent their money on a 6ft by 6ft beach hut, giving it running water and solar electricity, and takes inspiration for his own caravan design from some lovingly restored gypsy wagons.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of private chef Ed Versluys and pilates instructor Vicky Anderson, who want to convert a concrete cowshed in the Somerset countryside into a three bedroom home. With the help of one young builder and the knowledge they can learn from the internet, the couple plan to project manage the conversion themselves. However, they have only eight months and a budget of just over £200k to make a warm and comfortable home with straw bale walls and wide expanses of glass.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Anglican Reverends Neil and Ruth Mathieson set out to build a home inspired by all things Gothic and medieval, in the Adelaide suburb of Hillbank.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Tensions run high at King's College Hospital when police suspect a patient is concealing a weapon, while 58-year-old mother-of-four Hillary arrives in resus with a severe head injury after falling from her horse. Icylyn's bloated abdomen baffles the medical team and she has to wait overnight for a diagnosis, and 14-year-old Chloe receives treatment following her involvement in a fight.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the words-and-numbers game, with Jon Richardson and Joe Lycett taking on Sean Lock and Michelle Wolf. Adam Riches joins resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the words-and-numbers game, with Jon Richardson and Jonathan Ross taking on guest captain Lee Mack and Victoria Coren Mitchell. Jessie Cave joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Uncut
programme.desc: An extended version of the irreverent panel show. Jimmy Carr welcomes team captains Jon Richardson and Sean Lock, and guests Russell Kane, Rachel Riley, Alex Reid and Josh Widdicombe to answer questions based on opinion polls.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman embarks on a property search on the Caribbean island of St Vincent, and finds that a budget of £200,000 and house-hunters with uncompromising tastes force her to take drastic action to locate a suitable home.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition heads to Anglesey, where best pals Richard Tuke and Susan Hatch hope to show that Blackthorn Farm B&B, which they own, is better than any of their guests' establishments. However, they find that their close friendship is scrutinised even more than their property.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The White Swan Hotel in Yeadon, West Yorkshire, is the second stop of the competition, and owners Graham and Barbara Yellow hope their basic facilities and affordable prices will please their guests. Spiritual couple Malcolm and Fiona Piers-Taylor get good vibes from their room, Rachel Lonergan views the hosts in a new light and breakfast is well received by the contestants, despite having to pay a supplement fee.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Vegetarians Malcolm and Fiona Piers-Taylor host at the Old Mill House B&B in Bridport, Dorset, and both come under attack at dinner when Malcolm voices his opinions on meat eating. In the morning, a meditation session gets a mixed response, and most of the guests are left cold by the vegetarian buffet breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Rachel and Dan Lonergan welcome their guests to the Brighton Inn, East Sussex, where they hope to offer a luxury, boutique experience. Malcolm and Fiona Piers-Taylor give their room a thorough inspection, before the groups learns the art of building a human pyramid in the afternoon's activity. At breakfast, they discover a lack of vegetarian alternatives, and the hosts suspect game-playing when they are shocked by some negative feedback.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners come together to confront their rivals and find out how much they have been paid. Richard and Susan are keen to tackle the bathroom issues of Barbara and Graham, who bask in the comments from Malcolm and Fiona. The Old Mill House proprietors defend their vegetarian breakfast routine, but serve up snobby feedback to Rachel and Dan from the Brighton Inn.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman meets Clive and Carol Stephens, who want to relocate from their family home in Romford, Essex, to St Lucia in the Caribbean, so she searches the island for their dream property on a budget of £250,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman comes to the aid of Kathy Hector, who hopes to find a holiday home in Antigua, where she used to live. House prices in the Caribbean have dipped in recent years, but Kathy wants a dwelling that will offer a significant rental return.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Manor Moat.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the experts head to Llancaiach Fawr Manor, near Caerphilly, south Wales, to investigate an ancient moat. The team's geophysicists feel the site should provide them with the ideal conditions to determine what the ditch was originally designed to guard - but the project soon becomes one of the most baffling investigations in the programme's history.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team travel to Derwentcote in Co Durham, where they explore the Industrial Revolution's impact on the region by digging through the undergrowth to search for old furnaces and forges. Their investigation is also helped by the diary of an 18th-century industrial spy, and records from the time help shed light on how the area's cottage industries gave way to the power of expanding cities such as Sheffield.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Scott Miller visits a wildlife sanctuary in Dorset, where he examines a tawny owl that has an eye injury after being hit by a vehicle, and bottle-feeds two orphaned fawns.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Francis and Karen Shaw, who are hoping to save a castle in the heart of the Yorkshire Dales. While the project is a chance to fulfil a childhood dream, the building is a scheduled ancient monument protected by numerous regulations. As their expenses increase and they enter their second year of work, they suffer many setbacks.(n)

programme.title: Outlander
programme.desc: Claire's unexpected meeting with a British general turns tense when Captain Jack Randall arrives, determined to uncover the nurse's secrets, and the pair are left together alone.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Officers prepare to interview a care worker who has been brought in for questioning despite her adamant denial of the theft of a gold bracelet from someone she was looking after. Another man in custody denies being involved in a stabbing at a corner shop, while a suspect who has been wanted for six months has finally handed himself to police to be questioned over a violent assault outside a nightclub.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Documentary following life inside one of Britain's busiest A&E departments at King's College Hospital in south London. It's Red Nose Day, but there's little to laugh about for 33-year-old Dilson, who is rushed in with knife wounds to his head and neck after being attacked outside a nightclub. Meanwhile, 79-year-old Doreen has broken her wrist in a fall at home, and parents Keeley and Michael are concerned by the fact their toddler Cydney hasn't urinated for two days.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Sandblast. NCIS (Naval Criminal Investigative Service) is more than just an action drama. With liberal doses of humour, it's a show that focuses on the sometimes complex and always amusing dynamics of a team forced to work together in high stress situations. Leading this troupe of colourful personalities is NCIS Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs, a former Marine gunnery sergeant, whose skills as an investigator are unmatched(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Once a Hero. A former marine falls to his death from a hotel balcony, and investigations quickly lead to the discovery of another body. As Gibbs and the team dig deeper, they uncover evidence that points to the activities of a vice ring trafficking young girls(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Twisted Sister. NCIS (Naval Criminal Investigative Service) is more than just an action drama. With liberal doses of humour, it's a show that focuses on the sometimes complex and always amusing dynamics of a team forced to work together in high stress situations. Leading this troupe of colourful personalities is NCIS Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs, a former Marine gunnery sergeant, whose skills as an investigator are unmatched. Gibbs is a man of few words, who only needs a look to explain it all. Working under Gibbs is Special Agent Anthony Dinozzo, an ex-homicide detective who may come off as the world's oldest frat boy, but whose instincts in the field are unparalleled(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Smoked. A smoked body is discovered, and the FBI thinks it fits the M.O. of a serial killer they've been tracking for years(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Driven. The agents investigate the death of a navy lieutenant who died from carbon-monoxide poisoning in the robotic Humvee she helped develop and was testing. The artificial-intelligence vehicle was sabotaged to make the lieutenant's death look like a suicide(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Suspicion. NCIS (Naval Criminal Investigative Service) is more than just an action drama. With liberal doses of humour, it's a show that focuses on the sometimes complex and always amusing dynamics of a team forced to work together in high stress situations. programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Sharif Returns. The discovery of the body of a marine who worked with chemical weapons leads the agents to an old nemesis, explosives expert Mamoun Sharif (Enzo Cilenti). Also tracking Sharif, and now joining Gibbs in the investigation, is Lt. Col. Mann (Susanna Thompson), and she wastes no time flirting with Gibbs(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Blowback. An arms dealer captured by the agents makes a deal to give them the name of a top dealer who has the Navy's encrypted satellite system and is selling it to the highest bidder. The case requires someone to pose as a 60ish Englishman, so Ducky is sent on an undercover mission(n)

programme.title: Neighbours

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Ziggy takes sister Coco for a meal at Salt, where she steals some cash from a wallet. Kat tells Ash she needs more time to consider the adoption and John has an unexpected visit.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The guys invite the girls to a Dungeons & Dragons night when their trip to Vegas falls through after an incident with airport security. However, following a few drinks, Sheldon and Amy's relationship takes an unexpected turn. Meanwhile, Raj goes on a date with Lucy, who tries to sneak out of the restaurant's bathroom window - but ends up getting stuck and calling for his help.(n)

programme.title: This Wild Life
programme.desc: Wildlife expert Saba Douglas-Hamilton, her husband Frank Pope and their three young children move to the Samburu National Reserve in Kenya, where she is taking over the running of a safari camp. Things get off to a rocky start when guests arrive earlier than expected and an elephant emergency pushes everyone to their limits. Has the family got what it takes to survive their new life? Julian Rhind-Tutt narrates.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: New series. Chris Harris test-drives the Ferrari FXXK at the Daytona circuit in Florida and is joined by Matt LeBlanc and Rory Reid to race across Kazakhstan in three high-mileage cars - a Mercedes saloon, a Volvo estate and a London taxi. Actor James McAvoy guest stars in the studio and on the famous Top Gear test track.(n)

programme.title: Godzilla
programme.desc: Premiere. The only hope for the human race may lie with another equally destructive giant monster. Thriller remake, starring Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Bryan Cranston and Ken Watanabe.(n)

programme.title: Don't Ever Wipe Tears Without Gloves
programme.desc: New series. Swedish drama set in 1980s Stockholm, starring Adam Lundgren and Adam Palson as a same-sex couple who fall in love under the shadow of the global Aids epidemic. In the first episode, Benjamin, a Jehovah's Witness, accepts an invitation to a Christmas party, where he falls in love with Rasmus. With Simon J Berger, Marie Richardson and Emil Almen.(n)

programme.desc: The six remaining contestants head for Sarre Windmill in Kent for the third round of the competition. Meanwhile, Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins taste Britain's earliest bread roll and discover the hidden history of the sandwich.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country

programme.title: Obsessive Compulsive Cleaners
programme.desc: Hygiene-obsessed mother-of-two Jade cleans uninterrupted for six hours every day and goes to great lengths to avoid contact with grease and animal hair. She's paired up with Deborah, whose home in Dunstable, Bedfordshire, has been overrun by six goats, which are free to roam almost everywhere. Meanwhile, mother-of-three Lynsey heads to Blackpool, where newlyweds Scott and Faith are getting by without a kitchen and living among hoards of electrical items.(n)

programme.title: Louis Theroux: By Reason of Insanity
programme.desc: The journalist concludes his exploration of Ohio's maximum security state psychiatric hospitals, spending time with patients whose personalities are so intertwined with their mental illnesses it makes them more difficult to treat. Louis examines the grey area between criminal actions and medical symptoms, and investigates how insanity is defined.(n)

programme.title: Born to Kill
programme.desc: Psychological profile of Harold Shipman, the Manchester doctor who was convicted in January 2000 of murdering 15 of his patients - though a 2001 Department of Health report estimated he could have been responsible for killing more than 200 others. The programme explores his upbringing and medical career, and examines the possible motivation for his crimes.(n)

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: The case of Canadian politician Colin Thatcher, who became the prime suspect in the investigation into his ex-wife's murder in 1983. Thatcher had continued to abuse and harass JoAnn even after her second marriage had begun, and a sting operation was launched to establish his guilt.(n)

programme.title: Nurses Who Kill
programme.desc: The chilling stories of nurse Genene Jones, who worked in the paediatric intensive care unit of a Texas hospital. Over a 13-year period, she injected various drugs to induce medical crises in her patients, with the intention of reviving them afterward in order to receive praise and attention.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The five remaining contestants head for Bakewell in Derbyshire, where they are challenged to reinvent classics such as peach and blueberry, sticky toffee, and rhubarb and orange Betty puddings. Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins discover how the nation's favourite desserts helped change Britain's image abroad.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Denise Nurse showcases converted windmills in Lincolnshire for potential buyers with a budget of £500,000, who require 10 acres of land and stabling to accommodate their 13 horses.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A 17-year-old talks about coming to terms with having a child far younger than she intended, while her on-off boyfriend is in prison and will miss the birth. A serious emergency occurs when a baby's shoulders become wedged after the head has been delivered, and it has been so long since one mother's last child was born she feels she is starting from scratch and cannot remember what to do.(n)

programme.title: Motorway Cops
programme.desc: Police try to crack down on irresponsible lorry drivers by taking to the nation's motorways in their own HGV. Meanwhile, PC Angus Nairn teams up with traffic examiners to catch truckers using sneaky tricks to stay on the road longer than is permitted, and fellow officers Jess Rojek and Gary Williams respond to an accident on an unlit section of carriageway that has resulted in the injury of another motorist who stopped to lend a hand.(n)

programme.title: Born to Kill
programme.desc: A profile of American serial killer Jeffrey Dahmer, who sexually assaulted and killed 17 men in his Milwaukee apartment between the late 1970s and early 1990s. A necrophiliac who also practised cannibalism, he was beaten to death by a fellow inmate in a Wisconsin jail in 1994.(n)

programme.title: The Flash
programme.desc: Concerns grow for the increasingly volatile Ronnie when he attacks a physicist, so Barry and the team are forced to go after him - a search that brings them to Dr Martin Stein, a scientist who was working on a top-secret project. Meanwhile, Joe reaches out to Cisco for help investigating Nora Allen's murder and Barry begins to struggle with his superhero duties.(n)

programme.title: The Flash
programme.desc: Ronnie and Dr Stein agree to go their separate ways following the nuclear explosion, but the duo's plans to reunite with their loved ones are thwarted by General Eiling. Fearing for their safety, the pair decide to work together to get out of a dangerous situation. Meanwhile, Barry adds a new trick to his repertoire when he makes a discovery about the true extent of his powers.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The investigation into the murder of two private military contractors takes a dark turn when the finger of suspicion is pointed at Nell, putting the analyst in serious danger. Sam sets Callen up on a blind date, while in Afghanistan, Kensi is confident she has found her mole - are her instincts on the money?.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The murder of a diplomat takes Callen and Sam to Mexico in search of Tuhon, a retired assassin they encountered on their first case together. Psychologist Nate Getz returns to LA to partner Deeks while Kensi is in Afghanistan. Danny Trejo guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: Chris and Simon deal with a violent suspect they believe has tried to break into a car, while Daz and Rosie stop a van after a dangerous pursuit - but the driver refuses to give up and they give chase on foot down a dark country lane.(n)

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Angus goes undercover as an inmate in order to break a notorious drug kingpin out of a maximum security prison and be led to his secret headquarters.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: An undercover DEA agent is seconded to the team as they look into an explosion at a local fish market. Was it an act of terrorism or a drug deal gone wrong? In Afghanistan, Kensi investigates a helicopter crash connected to the elusive White Ghost, only to be put off her stride by an unexpected blast from the past.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: An undercover operative is identified and killed by a local gang, who post the video of the murder online. It proves a stark warning for Callen and the team, who kickstart an operation to find whoever leaked the information before more agents' identities are compromised. Concern grows for Kensi in Afghanistan as she turns herself over to the insurgents in an attempt to find the White Ghost.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team tries to exonerate McGarrett, who is in prison awaiting trial for the murder of the Governor, and the discovery of a hidden camera could prove to be vital in their quest. Meanwhile, Kono is suspended from HPD pending further investigation into allegations of evidence forfeiture. Starring Alex O'Loughlin.(n)

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Angus comes face to face with an international assassin hired to kill him, and must defend both himself and Bozer armed only with a corkscrew and paper towel rolls.(n)

programme.title: The Flash
programme.desc: There's a storm brewing in Central City when Mark Mardon, also known as the Weather Wizard, rolls into town looking for revenge on the man who killed his brother. Barry warns Joe not to go after the mad-as-hell metahuman, but his wise words fall on deaf ears. Meanwhile, Cisco makes a discovery about the night the team captured the Reverse Flash.(n)

programme.title: The Flash
programme.desc: The speedy superhero has his work cut out when Captain Cold and Heat Wave return to Central City with an extra ally in tow - Snart's little sister, who is packing a deep-freeze weapon of her own. Can he hope to run rings round all three as they bring the forces of fire and ice to bear on his beloved city? Guest starring former Prison Break duo Wentworth Miller and Dominic Purcell, and Peyton List from The Tomorrow People.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: The 3004 Olympics get under way and cheating is rife among the competitors as an ever-hopeful Bender decides a sex change will increase his chances of winning a gold medal.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Principal Skinner takes the school's underachieving pupils on a trip to ensure they miss a standard test and unexpectedly finds himself rediscovering his enthusiasm for teaching. Paranoia stalks Homer after he forgets to pay the family's insurance bill and leaves him trying to prevent a host of imaginary catastrophes.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Mr Burns wins a professional basketball team in a poker game at the annual billionaires' retreat. He decides to build a state-of-the-art stadium in an effort to lure fans, but the proposed site is on the last remaining bee colony in Springfield - prompting Lisa to lead a protest.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer promises Marge the trip of a lifetime, but when his penny-pinching habits get the better of him, he cuts a deal with a travel agent.(n)

programme.title: Flintoff: Lord of the Fries
programme.desc: Andrew Flintoff and Rob Penn head to south Wales, where they join in with a choir in the village of Blaengarw before frying up fish and chips for the locals.(n)

programme.title: Colony
programme.desc: Will returns to an unfamiliar workplace, Katie tries to stay on her best behaviour at home and Broussard and his cell make a startling discovery about the Wall.(n)

programme.title: Ross Kemp: Extreme World
programme.desc: Ross gains unprecedented access to the world of the Camorra crime syndicate as he investigates a street war that has claimed more than 4,000 lives in Naples.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: An online video sets Cam on a quest to restore Fizbo's good name, while Phil is in for a surprise when he meets his future stepbrother and Manny enlists Gloria, Claire and Haley for a read-through of his new play.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil gets ready to play in a charity basketball match, but NBA stars Charles Barkley and DeAndre Jordan show up and the pressure gets too much for him.(n)

programme.title: Micky Flanagan Thinking Aloud

programme.desc: Police in Colchester are called to deal with a man who has broken into a local school, while officers in Basildon come to the aid of an unconscious man found beside a motorway.(n)

programme.title: Brit Cops
programme.desc: Documentary series following the work of police officers in Lincolnshire as they tackle crime.(n)

programme.title: Animal 999
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the Scottish SPCA, the country's leading animal charity, as cameras follow the work of its inspectors and rescue officers. Staff are called out when a family of ducks strays into danger and a deer is knocked down on a busy road.(n)

programme.title: Animal 999
programme.desc: More behind-the-scenes insights at the Scottish SPCA as cameras follow the work of its inspectors and rescue officers. A swan is in trouble on a loch, a West Highland terrier causes problems in Greenock and a farmer's cows are in need of some attention.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life

Meanwhile, animal manager Jeremy captures the birth of a monkey on camera - and all looks promising as mother and baby get to know each other.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Life

That's bad enough in itself, but this particular pal is a computer networking expert, raising suspicions that a system for controlling Russian missiles could be at risk. In Afghanistan, Kensi is surprised to be reunited with a familiar face from her past.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The agents race to Afghanistan to rescue Kensi from the clutches of the Taliban, hoping a grim photograph depicting their colleague as dead is a fake. An emotional Deeks is determined to squeeze information out of a blind Muslim cleric who has been visited by a Taliban courier - but how far will he go to find out what he needs? Meanwhile, the truth about the White Ghost operation is revealed.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A 15-year-old paddleboarder is abducted, and the team faces a race against time to find her as she is not carrying medication for a heart condition. Meanwhile, Governor Denning introduces a new recruit, who is given the task of making sure her colleagues abide by the new rules. Captain Vince Fryer from Internal Affairs interrogates Kono and reaches an unpopular view on her career in the force.(n)

programme.title: MacGyver

programme.desc: A number of bombs are set off in Central City, and all evidence points toward a copycat killer. In the hope of tracking down the culprit, Barry and Joe visit the original criminal mastermind, a man known as the Trickster who is serving a life sentence in prison. However, while he agrees to help, it soon becomes clear he has his own agenda. Meanwhile, flashbacks reveal how Wells came up with the idea for the particle accelerator. With a guest appearance by Star Wars actor Mark Hamill.(n)

programme.title: The Flash
programme.desc: Arrow regulars Felicity and Ray arrive in Central City to ask the team a few questions about the latter's suit - and their presence comes in handy when vengeful tech wizard Brie Larvin gets her own back on her colleagues by unleashing a swarm of robotic bees on them. programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Bender attends a trade show, where he is completely overshadowed by an advanced new robot - prompting him to consider a radical upgrade that would also transform his personality.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart is sent to France on a student exchange, where he is used for slave labour by corrupt wine-makers. Back in Springfield, his Albanian replacement takes an unhealthy interest in the nuclear power plant.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer and Marge remember the ups and downs of their marriage through a series of flashbacks, including the time they each began flirting with guests at a glamorous party - a situation that led to a food fight and an unexpected swim in the pool.(n)

There's a new addition to the task force, too, with Krysten Ritter (Breaking Bad) making a guest appearance as data analyst Rowan Mills, and Weeds star Mary-Louise Parker plays Naomi Hyland, a formidable woman with a dark secret who shines a light on Red's true character. programme.title: Storm City
programme.desc: Documentary in which Ben Fogle explores the devastating impact of extreme weather, finding out what happens when man is pitted against the power of Mother Nature. He begins with the chaos caused by snow and ice, using real-life studies - such as Montreal being shut down by a fierce ice storm in 1998 - and sharing incredible stories of survival. He then subjects a specially built test house to an avalanche, one of the world's deadliest natural forces.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor's series exploring the world's most luxurious hotels concludes on the glamorous French Riviera. Beginning at the Hotel de Paris in Monaco, he is shown the art of perfect fine dining before meeting ex-Formula One driver David Coulthard, who explains why he chooses to call Monaco home. Richard then visits the Hotel Byblos in St Tropez, where Mick Jagger and Bianca De Macias tied the knot in 1971, before paying a visit to Belles Rivers.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor returns to explore more of the world's most luxurious hotels and begins in Miami's South Beach, home to some of the most hedonistic and extravagant establishments in America. At the Fontainebleau, he meets a man with eye-opening stories about Frank Sinatra's regular visits and gets a shock when he discovers how much it costs to hire a booth in the night club. Richard also gatecrashes swimwear fashion week at the Raleigh Hotel, where he speaks to the event manager about the many celebrity parties he has organised.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Tensions rise as the important New Hampshire primary looms on the horizon and Josh endeavours to get his trailing candidate, Congressman Matthew Santos, involved in the local debate. Political drama, starring Martin Sheen.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing

programme.title: Without a Trace

Forensic drama, starring William Petersen and Wallace Langham.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny enters New York's Hasidic community to investigate the murder of the man recently appointed its leader - only to find the victim led a complicated personal life. Jamie arrests the former mayor's daughter for smoking drugs in public, and her bad attitude leaves Erin unable to help her, while Henry upsets Frank by revealing a family secret. Police drama, starring Donnie Wahlberg, Tom Selleck and Bridget Moynahan.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The Withnail & I actor travels to some of the world's most luxurious hotels and explores the varied aspects of the hospitality industry. He begins by examining the roles power and money play in the business, checking into Caesars Palace in Las Vegas, California's Barkley Pet Hotel and the $44,000-a-night Ty Warner Penthouse at the Four Seasons in New York.(n)

programme.desc: President Bartlet encounters the economist with whom he split the Nobel prize. Several youngsters try to persuade Toby they should have the right to vote, and Kate tries to iron out a border dispute with Canada. Martin Sheen and Richard Schiff star.(n)

programme.desc: Josh urges Santos to implement a new strategy in a bid to reverse his fortunes as he takes his campaign to California. programme.desc: The body of a former boxing star is found floating in the swimming pool of a brothel. John Thomson narrates.(n)

programme.desc: Two teams go head to head selling cake mix and South African biscuits, with the most successful winning a potentially lucrative meeting with a panel of industry buyers. Culinary competition, presented by Gizzi Erskine and James Averdieck.(n)

programme.title: My Kitchen Rules: Australia
programme.desc: Carmine and Lauren convert their home into an instant restaurant for their latest culinary challenge, but they need to handle the pressure.(n)

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: The Proactive Squad from Thames Valley Police use unmarked cars with on-board video cameras to give an intriguing insight into vehicle crime and how it can be prevented, featuring footage of dangerous drivers on the overcrowded roads.(n)

programme.title: Customs UK
programme.desc: A passenger at Bristol Airport is caught smuggling cigarettes and admits to doing it for more than 10 years, and a suspicious bag is seized at Gatwick with £55,000 of cannabis inside. Plus, the crew of the fast cutter searcher investigates mysterious pot-markers off the Cornish coast.(n)

programme.title: Customs UK
programme.desc: Customs officers at Bristol catch three passengers carrying 87kg of tobacco. Claiming the amount is for personal use they put up a fight when they learn they may not be allowed to keep it. The crew of the Searcher boards a yacht on the trail of drugs, and a sniffer dog picks up a scent at Gatwick that turns out to be cocaine. John Rand narrates.(n)

programme.title: Stop, Search, Seize
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of Ireland's border force officers as they fight to stop gangs of organised smugglers from bringing drugs, money, guns, cars and even exotic animals into the country.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The mutilated bodies of five students are found in an unoccupied house in New Mexico. The Behavioural Analysis Unit suspects the involvement of a cult with knowledge of Native American rituals - a hypothesis seemingly confirmed by the discovery that the murder scene stands on the site of an old Apache burial ground. Drama, starring Matthew Gray Gubler.(n)

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan takes on a challenging case when a lightning storm damages human remains found in a park. A locket helps identify the deceased as a 16-year-old professional gymnast, and Booth raises an eyebrow in the direction of her mathematician father, whose preoccupation with work doesn't seem natural for a man who just lost his daughter. Meanwhile, Cam comes face to face with her identity thief.(n)

programme.title: Cold Case
programme.desc: The case of an autistic boy who witnessed the murder of his parents is reopened when his photographic memory leads Rush to a series of new clues and suspects. However, she struggles to decipher which facts are real and which are imagined by the bereaved youngster. Kathryn Morris stars.(n)

programme.title: UK Border Force
programme.desc: Officers at Heathrow's Terminal 3 question a passenger from Johannesburg arriving in London on a tourist visa, suspecting he may be planning to work in the country. programme.title: Elementary

Following a stretch in rehab for drug addiction, the damaged detective is entrusted to the care of Dr Joan Watson (Lucy Liu) who becomes a valuable companion as he gets back on his feet and starts helping the NYPD investigate the city's worst atrocities. Aidan Quinn also stars.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The agents investigate a killer who abducted three young adults from separate social gatherings, murdered them and returned their bodies to each location. Digging deeper into the lives of the victims, the team discovers one of them was hiding a secret about his sexuality. Could this be why he was targeted?.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The profilers turn the tables on The Replicator, pursuing a lead from a series of murders in Philadelphia. The victims' eyelids have been removed, but the subtle discrepancies between these copycat incidents and the original crimes could hold the key to unmasking the killer. With Scott Grimes (ER).(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team investigates a case of life imitating art when several members of an online writing forum are murdered and their tongues are removed. Meanwhile, the profilers are not convinced they have seen the last of The Replicator as several questions about their stalker remain unanswered, and Garcia encounters her ex-boyfriend, stirring Kevin's jealous side.(n)

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When human remains are served up in a school cafeteria stew, Bones believes someone has gone to great lengths to cover up a murder. Ironically, the pieces belong to a pioneering food scientist with an invention due to take the industry by storm - so with millions of dollars at stake, it turns out there are plenty of people who would have liked to make mincemeat of him. Crime drama, starring Emily Deschanel and David Boreanaz.(n)

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: Customs officers suspect that two men who have arrived separately may be connected somehow, while an aggressive passenger turns nasty, forcing officers to take drastic action. Plus, a suspicious parcel arrives containing an unexpected concealment.(n)

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: A busy day at Sydney Airport sees officers making a bust, and a passenger's mystery bag conceals something significant. Meanwhile, a boxer arrives at immigration ready for a fight.(n)

programme.title: Obese: A Year to Save My Life USA
